jobText: TXT/50535406.txt	§Communications Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Multiple Sclerosis New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§The Organisation§  §Multiple Sclerosis New Zealand is the national body for MS societies nationally. Working with member organisations, MSNZ aims to meet the needs of people with Multiple Sclerosis, their families and carers through national leadership, advocacy, communication, and national and international collaboration.  §  § §  §The Role§  §Reporting to the National Manager, this part time position (20 hours per week) supports both the MSNZ and the New Zealand Multiple Sclerosis Research Trust to achieve their missions. The role will be a key conduit for information from MSNZ to key stakeholders internally and externally, improving the lives of people with MS through various communications mediums.§  § §  §The Communications Coordinator has a vital role telling the story of our organisations, our outcomes and the needs that we are meeting with the goal of increasing positive awareness and engagement.§  § §  §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Developing communications to tell the story of our organisations, what we are doing, the outcomes and impact we are making, driving positive awareness and growing the recognition of our organisation.§ §Writing unique articles to inform, inspire and educate a range of stakeholders about MS. Provide information that is well researched and engaging.§ §Manage MSNZ and the NZMSRTs websites and social media channels ensuring regular and timely updates to maintain and grow presence, perception and engagement.§ §Assisting the Fundraising Coordinator with the communications and marketing of campaigns such as MS Awareness Week, World MS Day, Kiss Goodbye to MS and donor appeals.§ §Keeping informed of developments on MS and MS Research§ § §  §Ideal Applicants §  §The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years’ experience in a communications or marketing role. The ideal candidate should have experience with social media, websites, and have exemplary written communication skills. The role is multi-faceted and varied and will require excellent time management. As it supports two independent organisations the ideal candidate will be well rounded in their skills and proficient at multi-tasking. §  § §  §A knowledge of Multiple Sclerosis, the not for profit sector, health and research is a bonus. Experience in sourcing relevant and trustworthy information/research and translating into more easily consumable information is ideal.§  § §  §The office is based in Christchurch with parking available. Working from home for part of the week can be discussed with the selected applicant.  Candidates should therefore be able to work both independently and as a team to achieve results. The role also involves supporting 18 independent regional societies and so the candidate should be willing to provide leadership, support and guidance with improving communications and marketing nationally.§  § §  §To Apply§  § §  §If this challenging and diverse role seems of interest to you please contact §amanda@msnz.org.nz§ for a copy of the Job Description.§  §Applicants must email an up-to-date CV and Cover Letter outlining how your skills and experience match our needs and why you would want to work for Multiple Sclerosis New Zealand.§  §  §  §Applications close Thursday 24th September at 5pm unless the position is filled prior.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50537735.txt	§Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §bossed employment representatives§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Flexible work environment§Work with a supportive team who are experts in their field§Digital marketing focus§Why work for bossed?§When you join bossed, you'll be working for exciting business that continues to grow, with the aim to be NZ’s largest HR/ER services provider to employers and employees. Reporting to the CEO, you'll be a part of an effective support team, whose ensure our team of HR/ER Experts have the marketing assistance they need.  At bossed we know that our people are our most valuable asset and we remunerate our team members accordingly, as well as providing a very flexible work environment. §Purpose of the role:§As the Marketing Coordinator you will support and optimise our organisation's digital marketing programs, driving our digital narrative to enhance the organisation's image, improving digital communications with clients, and encouraging business growth through effective campaigns.You’ll be supported by a Marketing Executive who will work with you and the CEO a few days a month to confirm the marketing strategy, provide coaching and support your development. We’re proud of what we’ve achieved and are excited about where we’re heading. We’re redefining our boundaries and challenging ourselves to do better. experience: This role is ideal for someone with 1-3 years
jobText: TXT/50540602.txt	§SEO Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SEO Specialist§§Advertiser: §Uprise Digital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Uprise is a Wellington-based digital marketing team looking for friendly, down-to-earth people like us. We are driven by the view that huge volumes of marketing dollars are wasted, spent without real alignment to meaningful business goals, and backed by poor quality measurement, analysis, and care.  §Our fast-growing agency creates specialised strategies for our clients across all online marketing channels, with an emphasis on combining the data with smart thinking to help our clients hit their business goals. Our culture supports people to be accountable for their growth. We want you to be the best you can be; Uprise supports all our people in doing this every day!§This role is ideal for someone with 1-3 years of experience working in the Search Engine Optimisation space. What we are after is your amazing problem solving, numeracy, and analytical skills. We can put these skills to work and help smash our clients’ goals.§So, what will you be doing...§Auditing client’s websites from a technical SEO perspective, ensuring they’re set up for SEO success and nothing in their website setup holds back our SEO strategies.§Doing keyword and audience research, and looking at search markets and share of voice metrics to give client’s clarity of the size of the opportunity, their current performance, and what is needed to succeed over the competition.§Comfortable with Google My Business, both from a platform perspective and what’s needed on the website and other areas to maximise local search.§The ability to pull this information together into a coherent SEO strategy - a plan of action across technical changes, content creation and syndication methods to get the best organic performance.§Great knowledge of Google Analytics - what each metric means and what it tells us about our client's business and the success of their channels.§While not essential, a great working knowledge of Google Tag Manager and the ability to undertake and audit tracking setups would be a valuable asset.§But what makes an Uprise star?§Insatiable curiosity. Constantly asking questions and challenging information to seek better outcomes.§Amazing problem solving and analytical skills - you enjoy getting your hands into the data then working stuff out§Commercial, marketing, entrepreneurial curiosity - how do markets work, why do customers engage and buy, and why do certain businesses win more than others§Your willingness to run fast at a challenge and be accountable for your results§You’ll be grounded, humble, and able to have a laugh (often at your own expense) - being relaxed in your own skin and not carrying a big ego is critical!§What's in this for you?§A position that can let you have real, measurable impact on outcomes for our clients.§Opportunities for career and personal growth at a pace and direction driven by you!§An awesome working environment filled with a bunch of genuinely good folk.§Yes, we have great coffee, fruit, a beer tap, flexible working, a pool table but it’s not for show or to tick a “cool agency” box, it’s because we genuinely want our team to enjoy coming to work and to feel comfortable in their environment. When this happens, we believe people do great work!§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§§§

You will have the support, guidance, and direction from an external marketing specialist to execute defined marketing initiatives both externally, and internally within the franchise network.§ process.§        §ABOUT US§        §BarberShopCo is the largest and fastest growing mens grooming company in New Zealand. We are a young, innovative franchise brand who is creating a real buzz in the marketplace as we challenge the standard of mens grooming. You will have the support, guidance, and direction from an external marketing specialist to execute defined marketing initiatives both externally, and internally within the franchise network.§  §You will need to have great communication skills, a can-do attitude and be a great team player as you will be working as part of a collective wider team (both internal and external marketing resources) to get things done. §  §You will need to be technically and digitally savvy, and you will become the internal guru to all marketing resources, initiatives and campaigns, and you will become the go to person all general marketing requests and execution. §  §RESPONSIBILITIES§ § §Work closely with external marketing resources and suppliers to execute all marketing initiatives§ §Carry out all general administration relating to marketing, communications and PR.§ §Manage the storage and accessibility of all marketing collateral both internally and to the franchise network§ §Ensure all BarberShopCo marketing material is always up to date and available§ §Manage all basic website changes and uploading of content§ §Have a full understanding of the BarberShopCo Brand Guidelines § §REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS REQUIRED§ § §Confident use of Powerpoint, Word and Excel (Indesign and Photoshop experience will be an advantage)§ §Good design eye and attention to detail§ §Good priority and task management§ §Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)§ §Strong administration skills§ §Great team player§ §Work hours are flexible with a total requirement of 20-25 hours per week. §  §HOW TO APPLY§  §Submit your application online. §  §Please include a cover letter clearly stating your fit for this role. §  §Only resume’s that include a relevant cover letter will advance into the process.§  §ABOUT US§  §BarberShopCo is the largest and fastest growing mens grooming company in New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50546659.txt	§Digital Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Brown Bread Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§We’re looking for a digital communications ninja to help us engage and recruit members, followers and supporters for our non-profit and purpose led commercial clients and create campaigns with cut through.§ §At Brown Bread, we fight the good fight, rallying communities and brands to do the good stuff. Our specialty? Philanthropy, events, PR and digital communications.§ § § §Your focus?§ §Cultivating content, paid and organic digital marketing strategies targeted towards traffic generation, lead generation, engagement, conversions (sales/donations), customer retention, and brand awareness.§ §You will have a strategic hand across all key projects in our client portfolio. From rallying nominations for Kiwibank New Zealander of the Year to driving donations to the Arts Foundation of New Zealand and Boosted.  You’ll take ownership of every digital touchpoint, including client websites, social media channels, e-marketing, CRM, Google Ads, and display advertising.§ §Like any good strategist, you set bold KPIs, smash them, then have the analytical chops to listen, gather and report on all the juicy data - including recommendations for future growth.§ §Brown Bread is a BCorp and we take on clients that are looking to transform society.  We work with non-profits and brands with purpose and we give a LOT – so you’ll need  a flexible and positive attitude, where you’re up for anything, and nothing is impossible. You’re a natural collaborator and an affinity for projects with social purpose and the visual arts is a definite plus!§ §This position is based in Christchurch but we could consider an Auckland candidate to join our small team up north. It’s is full time, 40 hours a week, and on call at times. Travel may be required.§ § § §Key skills and experience§ § §Tertiary qualification in a relevant field desirable (marketing, communications)§ §Three to five years’ experience in a marketing or communications role, with a focus on creating quality content that delivers business results.§ §Strong experience in digital content strategy, creation and amplification§ §Strong experience in both organic and paid social media strategy, planning, conversion tracking and execution (Facebook Ads Manager, LinkedIn Campaign Manager)§ §Email marketing experience (you write a mean subject line, and follow best practice for data capture and GDPR)§ §Influencer marketing experience§ §Experience selling and implementing SEO and SEM strategies (Google Ads)§ §Basic CMS knowledge§ §Intermediate knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills§ §Proven, outstanding copywriting and proofreading skills§ §High level of creativity§ §Project and account management skills to propel projects forward independently§ §Keeping up to date on cutting edge toolsets (new social channels, digital marketing trends, web technologies)§ § § §To apply§ §Pease submit a bangin’ cover letter to show you can write, your CV, and some examples of campaigns through the Seek application portal by 1 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50548192.txt	§Content Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Producer§§Advertiser: §Rubber Monkey Sales Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Rubber Monkey is looking for a creative and organised Content Producer to join our small, friendly team. You'll be responsible for producing high quality content that engages our audience and increases our brand awareness and loyalty.§ §About the role§ §As the Content Producer, you'll create, curate and manage Rubber Monkey’s blog and video content. This could involve anything from presenting on camera to writing blog posts to managing video shoots. You'll also create a clear strategy for our content creation and promotion to maximise results.§ §Your aim is ensure our content has impact in the relevant areas, e.g. sales, engagement, brand awareness, etc.§and run well planned and executed campaigns, events and video projects. This is a newly created position so you have the opportunity to shape the role and make it your own.§ §Your responsibilities will include the following:§ § §Plan a content strategy for the Rubber Monkey blog to ensure regular and relevant content§ §Write blog posts and edit posts from collaborators§ §Be the presenter in Rubber Monkey videos and at live events§ §Find and coordinate regular and guest collaborators to the blog§ §Post content to the blog, ensuring it is accurate and well-presented§ §Work with the wider Marketing team to develop an appealing and functional blog§ §Generate ideas for content that will contribute to Rubber Monkey’s goals§ §Organise and conduct interviews with people of interest§ §Take photographs to complement content§ §Coordinate video projects, including: § §Creating script/content plan§ §Preparing set and gear for filming§ §Managing filming of content§ §Coordinating post-production§ §Uploading and sharing completed video§ § § §Organise events, including: § §Coordinating guests/speakers§ §Promoting the event and ticketing§ §Planning logistics§ §Running events on the day.§ § § §This is initially a part-time role of 2 days (15 hours) per week as we build up this area of the business. There is an expectation the hours will increase, most likely to full-time, over the next several months.§ §About you§ §Our ideal candidate does not need to have experience in all areas of the role as we can provide training and support, though some experience in marketing or content production would be an advantage. § §We're mainly looking for someone with the right attitude to own this role. You'll need to be a confident and outgoing person who can be the face of Rubber Monkey and take charge of this area of the business.§ §In addition, you will be:§ § §A great communicator, both written and verbal§ §Highly organised and able to manage competing priorities§ §Good at building rapport and confident in meeting new people§ §Able to work independently and lead projects when necessary.§ §An interest in or knowledge of audiovisual equipment would be a bonus.§ §About Rubber Monkey§ §Rubber Monkey is New Zealand's premier provider of professional audio, video and photography technology products to commercial, government, education and creative industries. § §Our goal is to shatter the idea that because New Zealand has a small population, we should pay more and get less. We are driven to compete with global pricing and provide our customers with the fastest delivery we can.§ §We are a locally owned and operated company based in Wellington.§ §How to apply§ §If this role sounds like you, click ‘Apply for this job’ and submit a copy of your CV and a cover letter stating why you think you'd be a great fit.§ §For more information about this role, please email jimmy@rubbermonkey.co.nz. Please do not send applications to this address.§ §We'll be reviewing applications as they come in so apply today.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§§§

jobTitle: Head of Marketing for ArchiPro. Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50549395.txt	§Head of Marketing for ArchiPro.§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Marketing for ArchiPro.§§Advertiser: §ArchiPro Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§We are looking for someone special!§ § §Gearing up to go global - Drive the future of the industry worth Trillions§ §Frequently ranked as one of the top 10 most disruptive companies in NZ§ §Backed by some of NZ’s greatest entrepreneurs and business minds§ §If you are bored at your current job, you'll be guaranteed to be challenged, we will pay you 20% more, and up to $200k in company options. §  §Our entrepreneurial culture and warm family atmosphere will surround you with a fun and dynamic work environment you will only find at ArchiPro. Currently Team of 50, quickly growing to a team of 100+§  §Here is our founder's and CEO story as featured on M2 Magazine; https://m2magazine.co.nz/refugee-to-digital-powerhouse-the-man-who-set-out-to-transform-an-industry/§  § §  §ArchiPro§At ArchiPro, our platform empowers millions of people embarking on their building journey - from homeowners and local artisans to architects shaping NZ’s most iconic buildings - fueled by our mission to simplify the building process, our goal is to provide people with an easy-to-access, one-stop destination for all things Architecture and Building. With headquarters in Auckland, we are actively working to grow our national reach and bring the future of online publishing to a nationwide audience.§  §We are looking for a creative, results-driven marketer with deep expertise in digital marketing to guide the strategic direction and operational execution to help expand and scale our platform reach. Combining a breadth of NZ marketing expertise and proven success in digital market expansion, you will be a key contributor to the teams across the organization shaping the future of ArchiPro.§  § §  §The Goal§To establish ArchiPro as the leading platform for connecting homeowners with products and professionals for their building project. You will lead a team of content marketers, editors, writers, and social media strategists all with the purpose of driving audience engagement, content consumption, brand favorability, and increased revenue. §  §Our Team§Our team is both rigorous and experimental, focused on data-driven marketing while also taking big bets on exciting opportunities, we seek team members who can deliver in a fast-paced environment.  If you are excited by data, passionate about finding new audiences, devoted to flawless execution, and motivated to continuously improve, we’d love to meet you. §  §The Ideal Candidate §This role lives at the critical junction of marketing lead, creative operations, and program management. The ideal candidate is deeply interested in product, content, culture, and understands how to motivate a team to produce and amplify exceptional work that makes an impact and engages our community. §  §Responsibilities§ § §Help guide a system and culture of content creation that embodies our brand, provides value to our community, clients, and aligns with our larger business goals.§ §Drive growth and impact across all major international KPIs: users, community, client, revenue, conversion, marketing ROI, LTV, and retention§ §Devise B2C (business to consumer) and B2B (business to business) integrated marketing campaigns with the aim of acquiring and retaining our community, users and clients.§ §Set the strategy for audience engagement by building models, establishing targets, developing and executing the overall digital marketing strategy§ §You will help drive campaign programming from inception to implementation; securing requirements, managing reviews and approvals, actively finding solutions, challenging habits, and navigating complexities. § §Drive and maintain key metric reporting and cost analyses to help optimize and iterate on the content strategy and to devise go-to-market localization efforts by market.§ §Select, attract, motivate, retain, and develop team members. Mentor to support their performance and development§ §Build ArchiPro’s cultural relevance through the planning and execution of strategic events and partnerships, and community initiatives§ §Utilize consumer insights to get a deeper understanding of our users, community and clients and develop insight-driven marketing§ §Skills and experience§ § §8-10+ years of broad-based and deep knowledge across digital marketing channels, ideally in consumer tech, marketplace, saas, media, or a closely related industry§ §Deep understanding of data-led  digital performance marketing including SEO, SEM, SMS, Paid Search, Social, Email, CRM§ §Experience building, launching, and scaling tech related products. Proven record of developing and executing new content series and content partnerships.§ §An entrepreneurial mindset, a penchant for experimentation, and a bias towards action.§ §Innovative and culturally attuned content perspective.§ §Deep understanding of performance tracking and ROI analysis; you should be very comfortable working in Excel/Google sheets and building reports and dashboards for measuring ad effectiveness§ §Possess a deep understanding of digital advertising, inclusive of campaign management and creative delivery. § §Familiarity with project management software and how to use it to drive transparency around goals, deliverables, and due dates (e.g., Hubspot, Slack, GSuite, Jira, Monday.com)§ §Please apply directly via Seek and the CEO will be in touch.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50551353.txt	§Communications and Design Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications and Design Manager§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§About Wise Management Services and the Role§Here at Wise Management Services we exist to power the Group everyday by providing infrastructure services, products and systems to all the Wise Group entities. Our greatest imaginable challenge is to become one of the best infrastructure services by the standards of any industry and widely influential as a role model workplace. Our values of humility, compassion and drive contribute to this being a great place to work along with our belief that work should be a source of wellbeing.§We are looking for a passionate, experienced and inspiring communications leader to join our team. If you’re looking for a unique opportunity to broaden your horizons - read on.§Wise Management Services provides business infrastructure services to a group of organisations working throughout New Zealand. Our work is highly diverse and links into the health and social services sectors.§This role is Monday to Friday working from 8.30am to 5.00pm from our Hamilton East office.§Our in-house specialist communication agency works across PR and marketing on a range of services and brands and has a reputation for delivering outstanding results with creative flair. Here’s your opportunity to land your dream job and join us!§You§Strategic, relationships, advisory and tactical - this is the perfect role for a seasoned, senior generalist communication leader.§We don’t need to tell you about the importance of relationships, reputation and credibility. You’re an expert relationship manager with experience you can demonstrate and you’re impressively qualified.§Working at a strategic level you’ve got the big picture covered, and it’s always front of mind. You’re also happy to dive in and colour the corners; you get into the detail, like variety and enjoy keeping busy. Combining in-house professionalism and agency polish, you’re a perfectionist with high standards; only the best will do.§Inspirational, professional and leads by example. That’s you!§As a diverse organisation, we strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our organisation. We are committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra annual leave, a gym on site and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its purpose.§Ready to take a closer look at the Wise Group? Then apply now.§How to Apply§We want you to introduce yourself to us as a team mate, be yourself and tell us why you want this job. Tell us about:§Why you want to work at Wise Management Services and not somewhere else§Why you want this role§What has been one of the most memorable or critical moments of your career to date§What do you do to keep yourself well, energised and performing at your optimum§Position description§: please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/WMS-Communications-and-Design-Manager.pdf§APPLICATIONS CLOSE§ 12pm, Friday 9 October 2020. Please note that we are likely to progress the recruitment prior to the end date and applications will close sooner if the right candidate is found.§Contact:§ Please contact Carmen Jacobsen, General Manager, People and Culture on 027 227 6774 if you have any questions.§For further information, visit our website www.wisegroup.co.nz§ §§§§

Synthesis Marketing is an outsourced marketing company based in Lower Hutt, serving companies throughout the country.§ §As our Marketing Specialist, you will be a key part of a tight-knit team working closely and directly with clients to develop and implement effective sales and marketing strategies. Our focus is on marketing that drives business growth with real and sustainable results.§ §This opportunity would suit someone with a few years in the marketing saddle. With a wide range of fascinating clients, this role is an exciting opportunity with no one day the same.§ §If you have a passion for marketing and supporting the growth of NZ’s small and medium business sector, then we are keen to hear from you.§ §Expertise:§ § §Client facing – the experience and ability to lead one-on-one conversations and small group meetings with clients and business owners. § §Marketing strategy – able to quickly build an understanding of a business, the needs, concerns and opportunities, and then use this to generate marketing strategies.§ §Business growth - possess a sound understanding of marketing and business growth principals and ability to assist the team with marketing strategy, planning and campaigns.§ §Delivery focussed – while you can work on strategy, you can also deliver and implement marketing activities.§ §Strong written marketing communication skills.§ §Specialist skills and experience in a particular area of communications, marketing (traditional or digital) or public relations would be an advantage but not essential.§ §Key Competencies:§ § §A keen learner – willing to upskill and seek new ways to add value to our clients’ businesses. This role will give you a huge opportunity to not only lead but also learn a wide range of skills across various types of business.§ §Must be able to work independently as needed and manage client needs with responsibility and confidence.§ §Need to have a sound marketing background with a keenness for problem-solving.§ §Quickly adapts to new technologies and systems.§ §Customer/client focus – a good communicator who sees customers as paramount and works to anticipate their needs and ensure their satisfaction.§ §Relationship management – interacting confidently with others, builds strong relationships through mutual respect, questioning and listening skills.§ §Above all, the right attitude is paramount. You need to enjoy working with people, be able to engage with them, and keen to solve their problems. You will have strong marketing experience on your CV. You may have a marketing qualification or have built your skills through practical roles.§ §Applications will only be accepted from NZ citizens or permanent residents. As we are keen to find our new Marketing Specialist quickly, applications will be reviewed as received so please submit your application as soon as possible. Applications close when the position is filled. To apply please submit your application through Seek with your covering letter, CV, preferred working arrangement (full-time / contractor / flexible working) and your remuneration expectations.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

This will be a busy and varied role, where you will be tasked with ensuring  the marketing and website management functions are carried out to a consistently high level and providing quality support  to the Betta Group.§  §In this role you will:§ § §Work closely with suppliers to create marketing campaigns§ §Drive our mailer production process including  layout, product selection, pricing and promotions maintenance§ §Work alongside our Graphic Designer offering support to ensure we meet required deadlines§ §Maintaining our internal marketing database§ §Maintaining our website databases in regards to products, price and communications§ §Creating and delivering Facebook and Instagram promotional plans and communications§ §Management of Google Ads§ §Provide accurate and efficient support to our members and GM, in regards to marketing and conferences§ §Assist with marketing administration and customer support§ §Flexible working hours and a 30 hour week § §About you:§  §To be successful in this role we are looking for someone with the following attributes:§ § §Excellent communication skills both written and Oral§ §Practical skills in Adobe Creative Suite (particularly InDesign and Photoshop)§ §Practical experience with websites and Online Shopping§ §Practical experience of digital marketing platforms, such as Google Ads, Facebook etc§ §Ability to plan, prioritise and manage your time with good problem solving skills§ §Accurate data entry skills, and excellent attention to detail§ §A 'people person' with confidence to ask for and present information clearly§ §Ability to multitask, work well under pressure and achieve deadlines§ §Computer literate, including intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office, intermediate Excel skills for data management, and a desire to learn our internal systems§ §This role demands flexibility, the ability to self-manage, and the willingness to be a team player. You must be legally able to work in New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50560288.txt	§Remutaka Cycle Trail Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remutaka Cycle Trail Advisor§§Advertiser: §WellingtonNZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§The role§  §Are you out there on Wellington’s trails every week? This might just be your ‘dream’ job!§  §We're looking for someone to support the further development of the Remutaka Cycle Trail (RCT) which is the Wellington regions part of Ngā Haerenga - National Cycle Trail Great Rides. The RCT can deliver recreational, social and economic benefits to the communities it passes by through increased trail related tourism, and the delivery of projects that will take the Trail truly from good to great.§  §If this sounds interesting to you then you’ll need to be prepared and experienced to work closely with stakeholders, taking responsibility for the management and development of the Remutaka Cycle Trail.§  §The role is part-time (0.5 FTE), and fixed term for a duration of three years.§  §Some of your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Work with trail managers/landowners and key stakeholders to operationalise and implement the RCT Experience Plan§ §Gather and share user insights with trail partners and stakeholders to improve business and rider experience§ §Encourage and facilitate development of new trail experiences including events and the offer of additional products and the clustering of businesses to build packages making the Trail easy to enjoy.§ §Coordinate work with landowners to develop, manage and promote a sustainable trail§ §Work with the trail marketing sub-committee to implement annual marketing plans§ §Facilitate work with all stakeholders to develop a cohesive trail story, brand, visual identity style guide and consumer proposition.§ §Being the central point of contact for the RCT§ §Work with the Regional Trails Framework Coordinator to leverage the investment being made in Trail development across the Wellington region.§ § §  §About you§  §We're looking for someone with proven experience in project coordination/management, and the ability to roll your sleeves up to get things done. You'll have great stakeholder relationship management abilities and will be able to engage effectively with diverse audiences.§  §The ideal person will bring to the role and team:§ § §Have a positive approach and 'can do' attitude, with strong attention to detail§ §An approach which is very outcome focused§ §Excellent project coordination/management skills and has experience working on and delivering complex, multi-stakeholder projects§ §Experience and strong interest in tourism/product marketing and promotion§ §Excellent writing and verbal skills including presentation skills§ §Experience in working with a wide range of stakeholders and communities§ § §  §WellingtonNZ§WellingtonNZ is the agency tasked with making the Wellington region wildly famous. Our organisation is shamelessly passionate about this wild and wonderful region we call home, and want to make it famous as the most creative place in New Zealand to live, work, visit and play.§  §Why people love it here§As an equal opportunity employer, WellingtonNZ truly values its people and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive, have fun and make a difference.§  §We have flexible working options that can be tailor made for you, wellbeing programmes, relaxed working environments, encouragement to be yourself and a collaborative culture. Check out some of the varied things we do in the video below.§  § §  §If this sounds like you and you want to be part of a diverse organisation all about making the Wellington region wildly famous, then click to apply with your CV and cover letter.§  §Applications close at 5pm, Monday 28th September 2020 and we'll be in touch soon after the closing date with an update on your application. For more information on this exciting opportunity, please email §People@wellingtonnz.com§, or a copy of the job description can be found on https://www.wellingtonnz.com/about-wellingtonnz/our-team/join-the-wellingtonnz-team/§  § §  §Please note that only applicants with the right to live and work in NZ will be considered.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

Your excellent communication and relationship building skills will see you relaying technical concepts to all audiences effortlessly. You will also possess a natural ability to guide others and tailor advice and recommendations to suit the business, stakeholders and the community.§ §In addition, you will have:§ § §Expertise in user experience, journey mapping and service blueprinting§ §CSS and HTML knowledge§ §In depth understanding of NZ Privacy legislation§ §Knowledge of Accessibility/W3C/NZ Government web standards§ §Te Reo Maori advantageous§ § § §About Orion§ §Orion plays a vital role in supplying electricity to our communities in Canterbury.  We seek diversity of thought and encourage an inclusive and flexible working environment.  This, together with our adaptable approach positions us well for the future.  We are committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and we seek to engage, build strong relationships and work together to create the best outcomes.  With a strong commitment to our community, we continually strive towards a sustainable future that can be shared by all.§§§§

You’ll also be tasked with meeting clients to review performance and to ideate other solutions that could be useful for their businesses.§        § §        §This agency offers a variety of digital services, including search marketing, paid social media marketing, email campaigns, and SEO, as well as creative content production and website development. Our goal is to provide the best digital marketing services to the New Zealand businesses so that they can grow digitally.§ §Our services cover most of the digital marketing spectrum including:§ §Strategy / Consulting§Social Media Advertising§Google Advertising (SEM)§SEO§ §The Role (Responsibilities):§ §We are looking for a full-time Digital Marketing Specialist with a strong understanding of the Goal & Principles of Digital Marketing. jobTitle: Marketing and Administration Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: Urban Development Institute of New Zealand
jobText: TXT/50570335.txt	§Marketing and Administration Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Administration Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Urban Development Institute of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$35 - $44.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§The Urban Development Institute of New Zealand (UDINZ) is a newly formed non-profit membership organization whose mission is to be the champion for great urban design and development, providing a platform for collaboration in order to achieve resilient, affordable, healthy and sustainable communities for all New Zealanders. §  §UDINZ is an open and inclusive national body that works from the grassroots through to Government. UDINZ members are a cross-section of people involved in building New Zealand communities, from developers to contractors, designers, planners, architects and engineers, through to materials suppliers, research agencies, financiers, real estate agencies, lawyers, accountants, councils and central Government. §  §UDINZ currently has a Chair and Chief Executive supported by a board of trustees and a membership base of some 70 members.  The Chair and Chief Executive are based in Wellington, and this role reports to the Chief Executive. §  §We are looking to expand our membership and add value to our members through an annual calendar of activity, thought leadership and PR, events, advocacy at Government level, professional development, data-driven market insights, international best practice in urban development and enabling the industry to collaborate to get to better urban development outcomes. Eventually as UDINZ grows, the organisation will likely host awards and conferences. §  §The Marketing and Administration Coordinator will be the Chief Executive’s right hand person to manage our membership database, website, ecommerce and member portal, member levies, events management, PR and social media management, and marketing coordination. It is a rounded, holistic role that will help the start-up organization build robust systems for member and marketing management. §  §We are looking for someone with experience in marketing, events, administration and ideally some digital and social marketing and ecommerce knowledge. §  §You will have a can-do positive attitude, and be able to turn your hand to many things, drawing on previous work experiences. You will be highly collaborative, systematic, and a great communicator with strong attention to detail and the ability to follow through. You will be responsive, tech-savvy and able to deploy new technologies to get to better faster and cheaper, and able to deliver a great customer experience for members. §  §You will report and work closely with the Chief Executive, as well as the Chair and board members, and UDINZ members. §  §This role is flexible, up to 20 hours a week, with variability based on demand at any one time, and will primarily be work from home. A detailed Job Description is below. §  §CVs and cover letters are to UDINZ Chair Fran Wilde at §fran@franwilde.com§ §  §Applications close on Monday 28th September 2020. This is for an immediate start. §  §Detailed Job Description is as follows:§  §UDINZ MARKETING & ADMINISTRATION COORDINATOR§  §The purpose of the UDINZ Marketing & Administration Coordinator is to grow UDINZ’s brand awareness and drive membership and UDINZ activities, as well as provide robust systems and administration for the membership based organisation.§  §The role encompasses managing UDINZ membership, ecommerce, UDINZ events, and coordinating activities including the UDINZ website, member and marketing databases, marketing collateral, direct marketing, social media accounts and media relations, as well as annual membership levies management.§  §This role reports to UDINZ CEO. §  §While the Coordinator is directly responsible for the tasks listed here there are parts that the board like to be involved with and volunteer for (and can be delegated to, especially re: events, training).§  §Database management§ § §Manage the UDINZ member database and UDINZ marketing platforms, with the ability to filter by region, organisation type, etc for marketing purposes.§ §Integrate the UDINZ databases with software applications such as Mailchimp, EventBrite and Facebook for marketing purposes.§ §Ideally data integration syncing ability between membership and marketing platforms.§ §Member levies and ecommerce platform§ § §Integrate the membership database with UDINZ financial systems, to keep track of member levies, due dates, outstanding & reconciliations within Xero.§ §Issue member levies annually and follow up on outstanding levies.§ §Implement smart ecommerce systems for member levies (eg easy payment gateways of credit card payment plans) and for UDINZ training and events packages, or insight packages, via the UDINZ website.§ §Ideally to create a member only portal/ login on the UDINZ website.§ §Membership enquiries§ § §Answer emails and enquires from potential members and the general public§ §Manage membership communications§ §UDINZ website § § §Update UDINZ website with a web developer to create a flexible, future-proofed, user friendly UX experience§ §Future proof ecommerce and member portal integration ability§ §Update regularly, check each page jobText: TXT/50573736.txt	§Social Media Manager - Fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Manager - Fixed term§§Advertiser: §Nandos New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§ § §Job type§: Fixed Term - 32 hours pw - 6 Months - Parental Leave Cover.§ §A bit about us§: We are a restaurant chain of 184 restaurants across Australia and 28 restaurants across New Zealand in a unique position of growth and change internally. We have a small central support team all working together, passionate to build an awesome all-round company based on values and people orientated principals.§ §About the role§:§ §The Social Media Manager is the brand champion and unique voice of the Nando’s brand in the social world.§ §The primary focus of the role will be on the execution and optimisation of the Social strategy in accordance with the Marketing strategy. The primary role of the Marketing function at Nando’s is to build brand equity, drive sales and increase profit.§ §The Social Media Manager will also be responsible for the management of our private Instagram page for our staff – or Nandocas, as we call them. The primary purpose of this page is to drive internal engagement and to keep our Nandocas informed about what’s happening in the business.§ §In addition to this, the Social Media Manager will manage all customer feedback & enquiries via social media, website & app.§ §This role acts as support to the Marketing Manager.§ §Responsibilities:§ § §Manage content on our brand social channels (Instagram, Facebook & LinkedIn), posting always-on content that is on brand and in line with our social media strategy.  This includes writing copy that fits with Nando’s TOV and selecting appropriate imagery that will resonate with our target audience.§ §Place targeted ads on social media to further reach and engagement.§ §Community Management. Engage with our fans via comments, where appropriate, and respond to all enquiries and complaints in a timely manner on our social channels, website & app.§ §Work with photographer & graphic designer to create content for social channels. This includes writing detailed briefs and being on site to manage shoots.§ §Develop social media activity to support brand campaigns. This will vary dependent on the brand activity but might include supporting new product launches, purpose initiatives or recruitment campaigns.§ §Ensure that all social campaigns are monitored for effectiveness against agreed KPIs. Complete post campaign analysis and make recommendations based on key learnings.§ §Ensure that all campaigns and initiatives are executed in line with Nando’s Brand Guidelines.§ §Manage content on our private Instagram page for our Nandocas, working alongside the People & Culture team to create engaging content. This includes connecting with Nandocas by responding to private messages and comments on the page.§ §Assist the Marketing Manager with the execution of advocacy feeding, including sharing on social channels.  § §Manage all activity to agreed budgets and ensure that the expenditure is in line with the agreed social media budget.§ §Monitor and evaluate competitor activity and trends on social media. Recommend actions to ensure Nando’s is ahead of the competitive set.§ §Build effective working relationships across the Nando’s business.§ §Promote best practise within the Marketing function and constantly look to improve processes and procedures.§ §Support the Marketing Manager in national campaigns & initiatives, where needed.§ §Build relationships with Marketing teams in other Nando’s markets to share ideas and best practise.§ §Actively demonstrate and encourage the Nando’s values of Pride, Passion, Courage, Integrity and Family.§ §Benefits for working with us§:§ § §Pay it forward, §we are a purpose led company and you will be able to take pride in changing the lives of others§ §Competitive wage§ that recognises your experience and initiative§ §Career Progression§, we take pride in helping people develop § §We run §social events, competitions and parties§ to ensure while we may work hard we play just as hard§ §Free Meal§ §Marketing Technical Competencies:§ § § §Copy Writing – Proficient § §Social Media Advertising – Master § §Social Media Strategy & Planning – Master § §Consumer Promotions – Proficient§ §Communication Development – Proficient § §Customer Relationship Management – Proficient § §Financial Management - Developing § §Selection Criteria:§ § §Tertiary education in marketing or related field§ §Minimum 1-2 years’ experience working in social media§ §Experience working in a retail background in food category is ideal but not essential§ §Extensive experience working with brand/s, with a proven track record in social media§ §Proven track record of building brand via social media channels, and increasing engagement and other key metrics§ §Strong business and financial acumen – a firm grasp of ROI§ §Ability to think strategically§ §Ability to build sustainable, positive relationships with groups inside and outside of the organisation§ §Strong communication skills (written and verbal)§ §Lateral thinker and problem solver§ §Good sense of humour§ §Apply now! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50574603.txt	§Digital Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Architectural Products & Technologies§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Who are we?§ § § §APT Innovation bring the best in Architectural Products and Technologies.  We are the exclusive distributors of Corian® in New Zealand and the Pacific Islands - and we're growing and evolving at a significant rate.  We have extended our portfolio to include IB Rubinetti tapware, Fenix NTM surfaces and most recently ATIM Transformables– all designed and manufactured in Italy.§ §As well as strong growth in high value residential housing, we are steadily increasing our sales in the commercial market with hotels, medical and shop fitting.§ §We are now looking to add a part time Digital Marketing Specialist to our team based in Penrose to manage our digital marketing platforms.§ § § §This is where You come in!§ § § §Our products are used in various high end residential and commercial projects so you'll be responsible for putting together really beautiful content so having a good 'eye for design' is what will give you the edge.  This role will see you working on content development across our social media and website platforms as well as campaigns and promotions.  § §We have some other marketing projects on the go – if your experience is more broad than pure digital, you may also be able to assist us with them.§ § § §So who are You?§ § § §An experienced Digital and Marketing Specialist you will be comfortable being the digital subject matter expert across all digital elements, especially on social media and website platforms. You possess strong relationship and communication skills and are absolutely passionate about what you do and how you do it.§ §This role is part time  and the hours can ebb and flow depending on what work we have on.  So it could suit you if you are an independent contractor looking to add another client to your books, or if you are looking for more work/life balance but want to put your digital marketing skills/experience to good use, but with the capacity to take on more hours as the role develops and our business increases.§ § § §What's in it for You?§ § § §With nice new offices with lots of natural light and onsite parking, this role will offer you lots of variety.  We're a small but dedicated team who are passionate about what we do and the industry we are in.  Working alongside an award-winning marketer you will be working with one of the best in the business! and as you come to understand our business so too will the opportunity to take on more responsibility and projects.§ §Make this role yours and give Dee Carpenter a call today on 021 224 7069!§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§§§

We develop our own subdivisions and therefore have a regular flow of residential construction work.§ §We are on the hunt for a Marketing / Design assistant to join our expanding, Oamaru based team.§ §You’ll have a good eye for design, photography and be a digital marketing guru to create engaging visual and written content that effectively communicates our story to potential new home owners.§ § § §An average day could include:§ § §Updating our design collateral and websites§ §Walking around our building sites and taking progress photographs§ §Creating engaging content and posting on our social channels§ §Digital monitoring, reporting and insights§ §Writing creative content for our emails and sending new campaigns§ §Working on branding for new subdivisions§ §Brainstorming ideas with the Marketing Manager and team§ §If you have a penchant for interiors you could help work on our show homes§ §Working with our photographer and videographer to create new content§ §Liaising with suppliers and business partners§ § § §To be successful in this role, you need to have the following:§ § §A Degree or Diploma in Marketing and/or Design§ §If you have a marketing degree you’ll need an eye for design and have some Adobe knowledge§ §If you have a design degree you’ll need to be a social/digital guru, ideally you’d have completed some marketing papers (a good understanding of Facebook Ad Manager and Google Ads is a real bonus)§ §Excellent creative written communication§ §High level of attention to detail§ §A social personality§ §Photography skills§ §A keen learner, problem solver and a team player§ § § §In return we offer:§ § §The opportunity to grow with the company and help shape it’s future§ §Job security with plenty of interesting work in the pipeline and our own subdivisions.§ §Flexible hours if required§ §A great company culture§ §Renumeration based on experience§ § § §How to Apply:§ §If this sounds like you, click 'Apply for this job'. jobTitle: Digital Marketing Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50575686.txt	§Digital Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Rabobank§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Digital Marketing Manager §      §        §Rabobank is the world’s leading specialist in food and agribusiness banking. One of our key strengths lies in our people who have a deep understanding of agriculture and are committed to adding long-term value for clients. Our commitment to our employees and clients is at the heart of everything we do§        §In this role you will be responsible for the efficient development and timely delivery of the website migration and social platforms onto Rabobank's Global digital platforms. You're a customer advocate and are willing to get stuck in to deliver the best online user experience for Rabobank and our clients. The scope of this unit is commercial marketing strategy and execution to drive the broader business objectives of the entire New Zealand operation.  You will be responsible for the delivery of effective digital marketing activations and content and their continued improvement for the Rabobank/RaboDirect brand in New Zealand. You will support the Marketing team in the delivery of key digital projects both internally and externally.§        §To thrive in this role, we would expect that you have a minimum of 5-7 years  digital marketing experience (B2B) within a large complex organisation. You’ll have hands-on experience with the development and delivery and optimisation of external websites. You will have excellent agile project management skills and expertise at managing a wide range of stakeholders. You will have experience including reporting and analytics, website optimisation and testing, campaign deployment, SEM & SEO, digital media, and social media.  Would expect that you’d have intermediate HTML and CSS skills and plenty of  experience using content management systems and associated applications e.g.  Adobe, Google Analytics, Adwords etc.  §        §Rabobank New Zealand fully embraces inclusion and belonging and delivers positive experiences for our people and clients. Our great working conditions, broad learning and development programmes and the opportunity to work together for the greater good are reasons why our employees love working here. We are committed to our values; we are client focussed, action oriented, purposeful and courageous in our work.  We are professional and considerate and bring out the best in each other and are committed to keep learning.   We have an open culture, where you can be yourself and be valued for who you are. §        §If you are interested in Growing a Better World Together please follow the link and apply online or visit www.rabobank.co.nz./careers§        §Rabobank New Zealand is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role. jobTitle: Performance Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50583558.txt	§Performance Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Performance Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Potentia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Base + Bonus & Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Performance Marketing Manager §    §      §Performance Marketing Manager§Lead full performance marketing growth strategy of this internationally focused Saas house §§Why you would like it:§        §          §High-performing environment aching for "growth hacking' capability§          §Gradient of growth sharpening from new global customer base§          §Senior role equipped with direct access to exec & deep resources§        §The opportunity:§§This organisation has and continues to enjoy annual revenue growth rates 30+% year on year which has been driven solely by inbound lead generation. Over the last 2 years that lead generation channel has slowly declined and there a genuine desire is to reverse the trend and increase the sales qualified lead (SQL) volumes. The role, whilst working closely with the wider digital marketing and product marketing teams, will be more aligned with the sales function as the primary KPI is the progressive increase in SQL lead velocity. Given this role is directly linked to the ongoing future success of this organisation, the successful candidate will report directly to the CEO. The ultra exciting part is there is also significant scope for extending the remit of the current role, upon delivery of successful outcomes, through into the parent company, a US PLC, who have to date pursued an outbound go-to-market model but wish to also avail themselves of a more cost-efficient inbound lead generation options. In short - the opportunity is a rare one.§§Company profile:§§An emerging global leader of employee communication software connecting large businesses with employees through direct and high-impact messaging. Offering a range of channels to get employee attention, with the right message, to the right person at the right time, these guys are grabbing Fortune500 clients at a break-neck speed. Harnessing multi-platform real-time alerts, digital wallpaper and signage, tickers, quizzes, surveys, and newsletters their clients can bring communications in all circumstances to their teams.§§The fit (of the ideal candidate):§§        §          §5+ years' experience in marketing growth and/or inbound marketing optimisation roles §          §Proven experience in marketing analytics or performance with an emphasis on B2B Saas§          §Naturally inquisitive, think outside the box and not be afraid to experiment to find the optimal result. §          §Comfortable having sales targets attributed to KPI's to ensure that there is a genuine link between performance marketing activity and sales§          §Experience with CRO, PPC, SEM, SEO, inbound lead generation and paid advertising§          §Confident user of GA, HotJar, and other marketing automation tools §          §Experience effectively influencing, planning and delivering projects, and demonstrating the value of optimisation initiatives §          §Experience building, managing, and shaping digital marketing B2B campaigns in an agile environment§          §Strong attention to detail, time management and project management skills §          §Familiarity with Salesforce and HubSpot§          §You have a growth mindset - always learning and taking ownership of your team's results, good or bad §        § §This is a genuinely fantastic opportunity for the right person so if you're looking to join a top class organisation with great progression opportunities, apply now or drop an email to §guy@potentia.co.nz§.§REF: GDJO-§2009-51656§ §      §      §      §      §        §          §            §              §t:§              §093685111§            §            §              §a:§              §level 8, 23 customs st east§ auckland, new zealand§            §            §              §w:§              §potentia.co.nz§            §          §        §      §    §  §§§Performance Marketing Manager§Lead full performance marketing growth strategy of this internationally focused Saas house §§Why you would like it:§High-performing environment aching for "growth hacking' capability§Gradient of growth sharpening from new global customer base§Senior role equipped with direct access to exec & deep resources§§The opportunity:§§This organisation has and continues to enjoy annual revenue growth rates 30+% year on year which has been driven solely by inbound lead generation. Over the last 2 years that lead generation channel has slowly declined and there a genuine desire is to reverse the trend and increase the sales qualified lead (SQL) volumes. The role, whilst working closely with the wider digital marketing and product marketing teams, will be more aligned with the sales function as the primary KPI is the progressive increase in SQL lead velocity. Given this role is directly linked to the ongoing future success of this organisation, the successful candidate will report directly to the CEO. The ultra exciting part is there is also significant scope for extending the remit of the current role, upon delivery of successful outcomes, through into the parent company, a US PLC, who have to date pursued an outbound go-to-market model but wish to also avail themselves of a more cost-efficient inbound lead generation options. In short - the opportunity is a rare one.§§Company profile:§§An emerging global leader of employee communication software connecting large businesses with employees through direct and high-impact messaging. Offering a range of channels to get employee attention, with the right message, to the right person at the right time, these guys are grabbing Fortune500 clients at a break-neck speed. Harnessing multi-platform real-time alerts, digital wallpaper and signage, tickers, quizzes, surveys, and newsletters their clients can bring communications in all circumstances to their teams.§§The fit (of the ideal candidate):§§5+ years' experience in marketing growth and/or inbound marketing optimisation roles §Proven experience in marketing analytics or performance with an emphasis on B2B Saas§Naturally inquisitive, think outside the box and not be afraid to experiment to find the optimal result. §Comfortable having sales targets attributed to KPI's to ensure that there is a genuine link between performance marketing activity and sales§Experience with CRO, PPC, SEM, SEO, inbound lead generation and paid advertising§Confident user of GA, HotJar, and other marketing automation tools §Experience effectively influencing, planning and delivering projects, and demonstrating the value of optimisation initiatives §Experience building, managing, and shaping digital marketing B2B campaigns in an agile environment§Strong attention to detail, time management and project management skills §Familiarity with Salesforce and HubSpot§You have a growth mindset - always learning and taking ownership of your team's results, good or bad § §This is a genuinely fantastic opportunity for the right person so if you're looking to join a top class organisation with great progression opportunities, apply now or drop an email to §guy@potentia.co.nz§.§REF: GDJO-§2009-51656§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50587833.txt	§digital coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§digital coordinator§§Advertiser: §Clothing Journey (NZ) Ltd t/a moochi§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§about us§ §Moochi is one of New Zealand’s leading fashion brands, as a vertical business, we control all aspects of the process, from design, product development, logistics and retail, including online.§ §Moochi is everyday luxury, from off-duty essentials to coveted designer pieces. The moochi philosophy is simple, we aim to arm women with a cohesive, adaptable wardrobe of pieces that work effortlessly together for work or play. § §We approach retail from our customer's point of view, striving to offer a premium, sensory experience to everyone who visits our stores and with new product delivering into stores every week, there is never a dull moment!§ §key responsibilities include but are not limited to§ § §propose and execute an e-commerce strategy to support our company objectives§ §act as the main point of contact for our digital agency with the support of our marketing manager in developing our new website§ §work alongside with our jobTitle: Digital Optimisation Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50588726.txt	§Digital Optimisation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Optimisation Manager§§Advertiser: §Timely§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About us§  §Timely is the world’s smartest appointment booking software servicing over 38,000 users in the hair, beauty, and wellness industries all over the world. Our beautiful, user-friendly platform allows our customers to deliver exceptional client experiences and effortlessly manage their appointments, clients, sales, staff, stock, reporting and more.§  §Our customers are our sun and we believe that a seamless and memorable customer experience is driven by the employee experience that our people have within Timely. We live and breath our values, including ‘Bring your whole self to work’. We celebrate the things that make us individual at Timely and believe that better decisions are made and better products are created when people can be themselves.§  §We’re not your average tech company. We operate in a clustered remote model with 80+ people spread across Dunedin, Wellington, Auckland, Melbourne and Greater London. We hire people who make the most of #timelylife and are able to balance their personal and professional priorities well. We truly look after our people, so at Timely you can expect a competitive remuneration and benefits package, including a wellness allowance and professional development fund.§  §What you'll do§  §The Digital Optimisation Manager will improve the experience for Timely customers from the point they first ‘meet’ Timely and decide to give us a try, right through their customer journey, with a primary focus on solo and small customers that are ‘unassisted’ by sales and customer success.§  §You key areas of focus will include:§ § §Driving customer insights: analysing performance to identify opportunities by revenue impact, establishing customer segmentation frameworks, working with Analytics to build relevant reporting in PowerBI and regularly communicating insights to the broader business.§ §You'll be a key player in the development of our strategy, recommending initiatives based on revenue impact with an eye for quick wins and be working along side our Head of Community to set strategic priorities. You'll initiate resourcing conversations to ensure your function is set up to succeed (and expand as growth goals are achieved)§ §Program management and delivery: You'll design, develop and lead the execution of optimisation programs to support your five areas of focus, you'll influence the product roadmap to deliver improvements that support your objectives and Collaborate with key stakeholders across customer success, marketing, product and product marketing§ §Above all, you'll demonstrate skills in leading projects across multiple disciplines, you'll be commercially minded with a clear focus on the business outcomes your work delivers and you're an articulate and proactive communicator who can explain matters in clear terms to many different stakeholders.§  §Requirements§ § §3-5 years experience in customer nurture and/or digital optimisation roles§ §Confident user of GA, HotJar, Google Optimize, Appcues and marketing automation tools§ §Familiarity with PowerBI, Autopilot, Salesforce, Chargify is a bonus§ §Experience defining and executing on strategic initiatives§ §Experience effectively influencing, planning and delivering projects, and demonstrating the value of optimisation initiatives§ §Strong written and verbal communications and ability to craft compelling customer-facing copy (preferred)§ §Motivated by working to performance/revenue targets, unafraid of being bold§ §Interest in learning about our audience§ §Empathy towards customers§ §What you need to know:§ § §This is a permanent, full time position§ §Ideally based in Auckland, Wellington or Dunedin§ §You’ll work from home but have access to office space when you need to collaborate or need a change of scene§ §We provide all the shiny new equipment you’ll need, a health & wellbeing budget as well as a fully-funded professional development plan which you can use for extra training, conferences, workshops, etc§ §Start date ASAP§ §You must be legally entitled to work in NZ§ §Applications close when we find the right person!§ §If you think this sounds like you, we'd appreciate it if you could prepare a cover letter outlining your experience and why you might be our next hire. §  §So you’ve read this far and you want to join the team. You’ve probably already looked at our website, Facebook and Instagram accounts, and had a read through our blog. You’re excited. So are we. Apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

The role encompasses all things marketing and promotion related. §You will be responsible for: §Supporting and delivering the marketing requirements for key areas of the business§Planning, creating and coordinating marketing campaigns and collateral to a high standard§Working closely with internal and external stakeholders to build strong business relationships and create effective marketing initiatives§Ensuring all UBT marketing stays ‘on brand’§Reviewing the performance of marketing campaigns and adjusting to optimise§General administration; including scheduling campaigns in the marketing calendar and managing meetings§What we are looking for in you: §Marketing experience (2+ years)§Exceptional business communication skills both oral and written§A flair for design, with experience in adobe creative cloud suite desirable but not essential§Experience in planning, creating and coordinating marketing campaigns§Experience with Mailchimp or similar EDM platforms§Highly organised and able to multitask§Able to build strong business relationships with others in different locations§Ambition and desire to deliver outstanding results§Proactive, unflappable and hard working§Administration experience, including minute taking and follow-up§The role is fast paced so you will need to be super organised and able to move quickly from one thing to the next.
