jobText: TXT/50616608.txt	§Digitial Marketing Role§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digitial Marketing Role§§Advertiser: §Magenta Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About the business§ § §We specialises in the sales, marketing and distribution of brands ranging in scope from European footwear brands, to street-savvy and contemporary lifestyle brands and Travel Brands, offering this corner of the globe access to a list of otherwise inaccessible international Brands.§ § §About the role§ § §-Responsible for website rollout updates – marketing campaigns, brand promotions, eCommerce growth plan and site projects.§ §-Responsible for all digital channels in the sales funnel, including CRM, EDM, SEO and SEM§ §-Build of EDM campaigns§ §-blogging and content marketing§ §-Sound experience testing new site features, enhancements and troubleshooting functionality issues§ §-Managing Social Media Platforms + Content Creation§ §-Facebook ADS and Google§ §-Onsite content and asset management - banners, promotions, images.§ §-Online sales performance reporting§ §-Implementation/setup of brand promotions online§ §-influencer Search for brands and contract set ups.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §-3-4 years' experience in digital marketing§ §-A high level of organisational skill, manage multiple campaigns across multiple platforms§ §-Google Ads – comprehensive knowledge of Google ads network, campaigns, optimisation, and delivery§ §-SEO and SEM Experience§ §-Graphic design skills and is proficient in Adobe creative suite or similar.§ §-Experience in end to end implementation of digital marketing campaigns§ §-Facebook – good understanding of Ads Manager and associated tools, pixels, audiences§-Funnel - ability to visualise & create conversion funnels from lead gen through to final sales§ §-Excellent written and verbal communication skill§ §-Good knowledge of digital performance analysis on different platforms.§-Knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager.§-Able to develop multi-channel digital campaigns.§ §-Understanding on site pixel installation, website tagging and retargeting methods for social media and brand sites is a plus.§ §-History of taking ownership of role and initiating weekly improvement§ §-Excellent written and verbal communication skill§ §-Ability to work autonomously and be hands-on§ §§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Co-ordinator/Cellar Door Assistant Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50616847.txt	§Social Media Co-ordinator/Cellar Door Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Co-ordinator/Cellar Door Assistant§§Advertiser: §Booster Wines Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Rest of Tasman§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Are you passionate about great wine and the stunning Nelson wine region? Are you a great storyteller who knows how to engage with customers both online and face to face? Do you get a thrill out of offering exceptional service to your customers? If yes, then we want to talk to you…§  §About us§  §Booster wine group is making significant investments in New Zealand agricultural business’ including avocados, kiwifruit and, through investments in the wine industry.  At Booster Wine Group (BWG) we pride ourselves on working hard and having fun while we do it.  We are the sort of company where you can really make your mark. §  § §  §About the Role§  §This role offers plenty of variety and involvement with our team and will mainly focus on Social Media content with an aspect of cellar door work involved. §  §The core duties include§ § §Assistance with the development and implementation of our annual marketing plan§ §Management of our social media presence§ §Content Management and Planning of social media posts for our key brands§ §Update website to ensure content is relevant and accurate§ §Assistance with digital marketing initiatives§ §Assisting with coordination of events§ §Coordination of marketing material§ §Other duties include:§ § §Working in the Cellar Door to offer tasting experiences to all who visit Us§ §Assist with winery tours and personalised wine experiences§ §Prepare tasting platters § §Upload customer information into our database§ §We are seeking a part time team member who is available to work a couple of days a week with some weekend work required. Reporting to our Cellar Door Manager, you will work closely with them to develop and create unique content for our online platforms as well as work at least one day a week/end in our Cellar Door.§  §About you§  §We are looking for a vibrant, outgoing person who has a passion for wine and has a strong understanding of all things Social. You must be confident talking in front of a group to offer exceptional customer service and experience in the wine or hospitality industry is an advantage. Flexibility is also important in this role as you may be called on to help with events and busy times in the Cellar Door.§  § §  §BWG is growing and we are seeking talented people who want to be part of our exciting journey.  If this sounds like you, we want to hear more.  In your application tell us why you would be perfect for this role and the company.§  § §  §Please only apply if you are legally able to work in New Zealand permanently. §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§§§

jobTitle: Digital & eCommerce Chapter Member Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50617586.txt	§Digital & eCommerce Chapter Member§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital & eCommerce Chapter Member§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital & eCommerce Chapter Member §      §        §About us:§        §The Warehouse Group (TWG) is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and grown from The Warehouse; we are the largest general merchandise retailer in NZ with $3 billion in sales.  TWG consists of four core retail brands – The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming and Torpedo7. We have 270+ retail stores, online stores as well as distribution and fulfilment centres throughout NZ. TWG employs over 12,000 people across New Zealand.§        §What we do:§ We enable delightful, optimised digital & eCommerce experiences to engage §and convert our customers. §        §What We Work On:§ We identify opportunities to leverage digital technology and data to understand our customers’ behaviour to optimise their experience with us. We do this through designing and implementing experiences on digital platforms. §        §What We're Good At: §We’re experts in systems and strategy within digital experience design, personalisation, conversion optimisation and eCommerce. We’re power-users of marketing technology, with strong analytical skills and a love for testing and learning. §Specifically, within Digital Relevance:§        §This is a great mid-level role for a Digital Marketing / eCommerce superstar looking to expand their skill set by working with global renowned tech and locally iconic brands. It’s also an opportunity to get a foot in the door with one of NZ’s most renowned companies and explore an impressive set of opportunities on your career path.§        §As an eCommerce Personalisation Planner, you’ll get to work with the ambitious and successful wider eCommerce team within The Warehouse Group.§        §Objective:§ To support the trading teams across the group by planning, implementing and optimising onsite personalisation campaigns.§        §In this role, we’ll need you to:§        §          §Support the establishment of a new tool and process to deliver onsite personalisation activity across the TWG group§          §Devise personalisation campaigns with the aim on increasing conversion rate & customer experience§          §Ensure all relevant sources of insight are collated and fed into the planning and optimisation process for personalisation§          §Identifies trends and patterns in the data, applies statistical vigilance to derive accurate insights and can then translate them into optimisation actions for relevant teams§          §Deliver a seamless end to end online customer journey, analysing sales, onsite channel metrics and traffic to improve the customer journey and optimize customer experience and sales growth§          §Be a culture/execution carrier of innovation and creativity applied to customer and business outcomes§          §Help drive the automation of non-product content so that we can offer a personalised online experience§        §        §Qualifications§        §To succeed in this role, you will need to have considerable prior experience working with a digital platform as well as coming from a strong digital content management background. You will have an innate ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment topped with changing requirements.§        §You will be an enthusiastic individual with the ability to assist with online merchandising of a full range of products.§        §          §Must have minimum 2+yrs experience in delivering online experiences in consumer internet and retail markets§          §Commercially savvy with a sales focus to maximise conversion and cross selling§          §Highly computer literate and detail focussed§          §Excellent communication skills; pro-active and highly motivated§          §Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks, to prioritise them and meet deadlines with heavy emphasis on realising measurable customer/financial goals §          §Demonstrated analytical skills§        §        §Additional information§        §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §        §Does this move excite you and sound like something you’re up for? §Apply today!§      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§About us:§  §The Warehouse Group (TWG) is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and grown from The Warehouse; we are the largest general merchandise retailer in NZ with $3 billion in sales.  TWG consists of four core retail brands – The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming and Torpedo7. We have 270+ retail stores, online stores as well as distribution and fulfilment centres throughout NZ. TWG employs over 12,000 people across New Zealand.§  §What we do:§ We enable delightful, optimised digital & eCommerce experiences to engage §and convert our customers. §  §What We Work On:§ We identify opportunities to leverage digital technology and data to understand our customers’ behaviour to optimise their experience with us. We do this through designing and implementing experiences on digital platforms. §  §What We're Good At: §We’re experts in systems and strategy within digital experience design, personalisation, conversion optimisation and eCommerce. We’re power-users of marketing technology, with strong analytical skills and a love for testing and learning. §Specifically, within Digital Relevance:§  §This is a great mid-level role for a Digital Marketing / eCommerce superstar looking to expand their skill set by working with global renowned tech and locally iconic brands. It’s also an opportunity to get a foot in the door with one of NZ’s most renowned companies and explore an impressive set of opportunities on your career path.§  §As an eCommerce Personalisation Planner, you’ll get to work with the ambitious and successful wider eCommerce team within The Warehouse Group.§  §Objective:§ To support the trading teams across the group by planning, implementing and optimising onsite personalisation campaigns.§  §In this role, we’ll need you to:§ § §Support the establishment of a new tool and process to deliver onsite personalisation activity across the TWG group§ §Devise personalisation campaigns with the aim on increasing conversion rate & customer experience§ §Ensure all relevant sources of insight are collated and fed into the planning and optimisation process for personalisation§ §Identifies trends and patterns in the data, applies statistical vigilance to derive accurate insights and can then translate them into optimisation actions for relevant teams§ §Deliver a seamless end to end online customer journey, analysing sales, onsite channel metrics and traffic to improve the customer journey and optimize customer experience and sales growth§ §Be a culture/execution carrier of innovation and creativity applied to customer and business outcomes§ §Help drive the automation of non-product content so that we can offer a personalised online experience§ §Qualifications§  §To succeed in this role, you will need to have considerable prior experience working with a digital platform as well as coming from a strong digital content management background. You will have an innate ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment topped with changing requirements.§  §You will be an enthusiastic individual with the ability to assist with online merchandising of a full range of products.§ § §Must have minimum 2+yrs experience in delivering online experiences in consumer internet and retail markets§ §Commercially savvy with a sales focus to maximise conversion and cross selling§ §Highly computer literate and detail focussed§ §Excellent communication skills; pro-active and highly motivated§ §Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks, to prioritise them and meet deadlines with heavy emphasis on realising measurable customer/financial goals § §Demonstrated analytical skills§ §Additional information§  §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §  §Does this move excite you and sound like something you’re up for? §Apply today!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621297.txt	§Internal Communications Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Internal Communications Executive§§Advertiser: §Competenz§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§“Transforming lives, every learner, every time”§  §World-class skills for industry§  §The Cz way: Explore ideas: §embrace the new§, Team up: §unite and share§, Make it happen: §own the outcome§  §Internal Communications Executive fixed term 9 months§ §The role:§  §Reporting to the Marketing & Communications Manager, this role will have responsibility for planning and developing internal communications programmes. A key focus of this role will be the ability to develop relationships across the business to ensure that initiatives are effectively communicated. Your natural ability to build relationships and to actively seek opportunities that support and promote industry training will shine through.§  § §  §What skills you will you bring:§ § §A degree in journalism, communications or marketing§ §3-5 years’ in a communications role § §Strong writing skills and demonstrated ability to build and execute communications plans§ §Demonstrated ability to maximise online and social media communications and marketing opportunities, including digital marketing§ §Excellent relationship building skills§ §High level of computer literacy§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Understanding of education or training industry beneficial§ §Why work for us/What’s on offer:§ § §Competitive remuneration§ §Flexible working arrangement§ §Work from home a couple of days per week § §Great modern offices in vibrant Newmarket§ §Great coffee available on site§ §Extra-long, long weekends – we finish midday on day before long weekends§ § §  §Who are we/Why join us?§  §Competenz§ helps Kiwis build skills, careers and businesses.§  §We are an Industry Training Organisation. We work with over 3,500 companies and 20,000+ learners in 36 industries around New Zealand each year to build skills, careers and businesses. Most learning takes place on-the-job.§  §We partner with employers, apprentices, schools, training providers and assessors across the country to help New Zealanders. We are geographically spread across New Zealand and our main support office is centrally situated at Newmarket, Auckland.§  §To find out more about us, visit www.competenz.org.nz.§  §We make a real difference in people’s lives. Come join us to give back to the community.§  §Please note: we do not always work to fixed closing dates and may start considering applications as they are received so we encourage you to apply early.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' of corporate communications experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Many of our communications revolve around stories of cancer, so this position demands somebody with empathy, resilence and emotional intelligence.§ §Duties & Responsibilities§ § §Supporting press releases, website, social media, and email communications§ §Editing, designing, and revising content§ §Oversee internal communications and distribution channels across the Division§ §Assisting in reporting activity against metrics in order to help measure success§ §Helping to prepare marketing collateral, training sessions etc including flyers, posters, ads, infographics etc§ §Assist with fundraising events throughout the Cancer Society Wellington Division§ §General administrative support§ §Experience & Requirements§ § §A relevant qualification and/or practical experience§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Superior organisational and time management skills§ §Strong copywriting, editing, and proofing skills§ §Tech skills: Website CMS – Silverstripe or similar, Google Analytics and e-Commerce experience, Social media (Currently Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Youtube), Mailchimp or similar, Google documents, DropBox, Trello, Microsoft Suite etc§ §Can productively liaise with media partners, suppliers and our supporters§ §Proactive and always looking for communications strategies that can be created or improved.§ §An interest in working with the charity sector and enjoys researching and understanding our unique position in the market. Seeks out information about our target market by reading what’s current in the industry.§ §Working knowledge of Adobe CC, primarily InDesign and Photoshop, and skills in photography/videography will be highly beneficial§ §A commitment to confidentiality is required at all times§ §As we are anticipating a high volume of interest, applications will close at 5 pm, Tuesday 13 October 2020. Interviews will commence from Monday19th October.  So please act quickly if this role sounds like you! Please apply through Seek or call Ione Slater, Communications Team Lead §04 389 0057§ for more information.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50622028.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Giltrap Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Location:          Auckland§  §Package:         Salary§  § §  §Marketing Executive§ § §Work in the leading edge of Automotive§ §A great opportunity to develop into a department leader § §Be part of a new company working with the world’s leading automotive brands§ §Work for the Giltrap Group; a leading New Zealand business § § §  §About Us:§  §The Giltrap Group is proud to be a family-owned New Zealand business. Our mission is to deliver a world-leading customer experience.§  §We love cars, and we care about our people. Across the Giltrap Group, we share a common vision to be the best at whatever we do. We believe this is done by working together, taking ownership to do the right thing, and going the extra mile every time.§  §The Giltrap Group is soon to launch a luxury focused ‘New Mobility’ business for the New Zealand market.  The business will develop new forms of car ownership linked to prestigious brands such as Audi, Volkswagen, Range Rover, and Skoda.§  § §  §About the Role:§  §To become a leading Mobility company we are looking to appoint an experienced Marketing Executive to develop and implement effective brand-building strategies and digital marketing activities. This newly created role is an opportunity to launch the brand and drive performance through marketing initiatives.§  §Your goal will be to increase brand awareness and drive e commerce sales through effective brand and marketing campaigns. Reporting to the CEO with a dotted line to the Managing Director you will assist with:§ § §Development of brands and marketing strategies for brand awareness§ §Manage agencies developing content, media and PR§ §Optimising marketing and promotional campaigns with a focus on the digital landscape§ §Analysing brand performance, campaigns, competitors’ activities, and consumer trends to provide recommendations for brand development§ §Tracking budgets, pricing and forecasting, product and range optimisation§ §Presentation and execution of creative ideas for marketing activities pertaining to brand building§ §Liaise with Branch Managers to ensure plans are articulated according to brand standards and complete submissions for their marketing campaigns§ §Reporting to brand holders/suppliers with appropriate analysis§ § §  §Key Experience we are looking for:§ § §3-5 years’ Marketing experience § §Tertiary Qualifications in business and/or marketing§ §Commercial Acumen – you need to know if your actions will improve the bottom line§ §Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills§ §Experience in marketing products across digital and social media§ §Strong organisation and multi-tasking skills § § §  §This is a unique opportunity to join the Giltrap Group in a new business enterprise. §  §If you have the skills and mindset, please apply by the closing date of Thursday 1st of October 2020.§  §Only applicants with the right to legally live and work in NZ are eligible to apply for this role.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing executive?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: External Marketing and Sales Coordinator (0.5FTE) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50622197.txt	§External Marketing and Sales Coordinator (0.5FTE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§External Marketing and Sales Coordinator (0.5FTE)§§Advertiser: §Essentially Men Education Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§APPLICATIONS CLOSE ON SUNDAY 4 OCTOBER 2020§ §Download a full role description §HERE§ §In this role you will be the public face of Essentially Men Education Trust (EMET) and our first point of contact to the wider community. You will hold the voice of EMET and how we speak into the world.  You will need to be able to competently define, develop and maintain this voice.  You will handle all enquiries from outside of the EM network. § §You will be promoting our workshops, to the wider community and professionals that refer men, through regular communication as well as developing external networks with referrers.  You will proactively look for ways to increase awareness of EMET and the programmes we offer through personal representation and various media options. Maintenance of the website and other online mediums will also be your responsibility.§KEY TASKS: § § § §Marketing outside of EMET Network§ §Sales & Client Liaison§ §Communication§ §Media / Social Media§ §Trade shows / Conferences / Presentations§ §Website§ §Billboards§ §About Essentially Men:§ §Our purpose is to connect and inspire men. Our approach is experiential, holistic and 100% New Zealand-grown in response to the needs and diversity of men in New Zealand. We conduct events for men of all ages and foster an ethos of men supporting each other within the context of their whanau and community. We encourage community development, a culture of service, and respect for women. www.essentiallymen.net§ §For more information send an email to §hiring@essentiallymen.net§ §To apply for the role please send your CV and a covering letter to §hiring@essentiallymen.net§ § §§§§

Having now been running for over 20 years, Pathways has grown out of Essentially Men's decades of experience with adult males. §KEY TASKS:§Programme Review and Development§Marketing and Promotion§Community Development§Project management§Tending to the Organisation Culture§Website§The Pathways Development role will lift the profile and reach of the Pathways to Manhood programme by networking effectively to other youth organisations, schools and other potential referrers; spreading awareness of the rites of passage approach, and developing sustainable options for growing an integrated leadership programme and an effective support community for young men. So instead, we decided to shift our focus to combining both marketing and sales to create:§ §Helpful value-driven content designed to help solve customer’s needs.§Marketing that is aligned with the goals of the business and that of the customer.§ §We do this through our unique blend of creativity and data, or what we call magic and logic. We inspire others to Live in the Blue!§ §Our Values§ §We are climbers§ – we are hustlers, and go getters, striving to reach the top together.  We pursue excellence on the way.§ §We seek space§ – we seek time to take a breath, allow space for reflection, planning and growth.  We encourage taking the time to think slow and act fast. § §We create oxygen §– we care about the survival of others, our employees, our suppliers, and our customers.  We create the oxygen they need for their success.§ § § §Role Purpose§ §This hybrid role has been created to help Blue Eye Deer AND our customers grow.  The purpose of the role is to support our customers with their digital marketing strategy as well as conversion of leads and managing client relationships for Blue Eye Deer.§ §Marketing Strategist§ §Set specific marketing goals for our customers§Design and implement marketing strategies aligned with their business targets§Develop digital campaigns, including SEO to increase web traffic§Analyze sales and marketing metrics§Keep abreast of marketing trends§Generate innovative ideas to promote our customers brand and their products§Address their advertising needs§Ensure customers brand consistency through all marketing channels§Use customer feedback to ensure client satisfaction§Liaise with internal teams and ensure brand consistency§Liaise with and manage freelancers and contractors§Manage, monitor and report on budgets§ §Client Relationship Management§ §Manage customer relationships including expectations and outcomes§Build long term trusted relationships with customers§Identify opportunities to have further impact with customers§Provide customer support where needed§Respond to complaints and resolve issues to ensure customer success and satisfaction§Prepare and present reports on key activities and OKRs§Support sales through contribution to proposals and defining the sales strategy§ §Qualification and experience§ §2+ years experience in digital marketing strategy§2+ years in business development and sales§Strong experience in Digital Marketing including social, CRM and data§ §Essential Competencies Required§ §Ability to work autonomously§Proactive§Ability to self motivate§Ambitious and eager§Team Player§Optimistic outlook§ § § §The Blue Eye Deer Competencies§ §Fueled by Curiosity §The ability to look at different ways of doing things, bring ideas to the table, use of initiative and solutions focused.§Quick Shift §The ability to adapt, shift gears or change direction quickly, sometimes working with ambiguity.  The ability to switch context often whilst maintaining pace and energy. § §Blue Eye Deer Mindset §Growth mindset, continuous self-development, open to coaching and feedback. Having emotional Intelligence.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§§§

jobText: TXT/50625065.txt	§Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Timaru District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§The district§Timaru District is a thriving and innovative community. It is the central hub for the South Island, servicing a large agricultural heartland, with a growing economy that provides the import and export gateway for primary sectors. We boast a Top 10 most loved beach in New Zealand and have access to mountains, rivers and lakes, making Timaru an ideal destination for recreational, sporting and cultural pursuits.§Let's not forget about that seven minute commute to work!§The organisation§The Timaru District Council aims to enable democratic local decision-making and action by, and on behalf of communities, to promote the social, economic, environmental, and cultural well-being of its communities in the present and for the future.With around 400 staff, there are a diverse range of roles from front facing community to support and technical specialists.§The role§Timaru District Council is all about connecting with our community and making sure they are not only aware of what's going on in their district, but giving them the opportunity to be part of it! We are the Aoraki Region's largest provider of public services, infrastructure, venues and facilities.§The Communications Advisor would help actively communicate and market Council services, ensuring that we present a cohesive and professional view, helping people realise the 'hidden value' of many of the services they use every day, and helping run public campaigns about activities people can do.§The person§This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced comms practitioner to develop their skills in a busy, progressive and vibrant Council. jobTitle: PORTAINER.IO- Digital Marketing and Community Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50626277.txt	§PORTAINER.IO- Digital Marketing and Community Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PORTAINER.IO- Digital Marketing and Community Manager§§Advertiser: §AssessAdvantage§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Portainer.io: Digital Marketing and Community Manager: Who, What, Why & Where  § § §Portainer is on a mission to make container management simple, quick, and easy.  Whether it's Kubernetes, Swarm, Docker, or Edge compute, the drive to create expert, elegant, simple, yet powerful tools that make the complex simple is what makes us tick.§ §In its first three years, Portainer has experienced staggering global uptake of its Open Source product, with hundreds of thousands of active users and many hundreds of millions of downloads.  Now we're making the transition to our first commercial product, backed by an awesome group of global investors.§ §To help us bring our vision for Portainer to life, we're searching for a smart, tech-savvy and adventurous, §Digital Marketing and Community Manager§.§ §Who?§ §We're looking for someone who can lead our digital marketing and community practice and who has the skills and passion to:§ § §Translate our marvellous tech teams content into stuff that our users want to see and can understand§ §Drive our social media and web presence - manage and measure our success with social media and our website, whilst ensuring we react to questions and provide insights to support our clients§ §Create industry-leading product-related content (blogging, webinars, newsletters, podcasting, social media, executive thought leadership, and more)§ §Inspire our growing community and help them use our tools to create value§ §Provide tech-centric marketing advice and support, collateral, and documentation§ §This role could suit a contractor, or we are flexible as to how you might want to work as a permanent employee but we will need you in Auckland to partner with the team regularly.§ § § §What?§ §As the §Digital Marketing and Community Manager,§ you will be responsible for:§ § §Managing the day to day marketing and social media work§ §Implementing and maintaining our community (online and offline) and growing the energy and enthusiasm of the Portainer community§ §Implementing and managing the community strategy and execute regular events to engage the community continually§ §Researching trends and hot topics by engaging with the latest industry developments§ §Actively listening to customers, addressing their concerns, demonstrating an authentic social presence, and maintain productive partnerships with consumers§ §Managing the creation of product-led content for our clients§ §Managing and tracking our website and social media channels (content, performance, engagement, etc.)§ §Collecting data and driving processes and projects based on community feedback§ §Driving innovative new frameworks, processes, and strategies for continual improvement in the quality and meaningfulness of Portainer' s community programme§ § § §For this to be the right job for you, you'll need to:§ § §3-5 years experience managing products or solutions in the Tech sector§ §Be a big-picture thinker and able to dive deep into the details that help our community feel seen and heard, but also be hands-on§ §Think outside the box, operate with a sense of urgency, and have a knack for finding unique solutions to problems§ §Be a strong communicator and have excellent writing skills§ §Be comfortable working autonomously, but also thrive in a team setting§ §Be data and analytics centric and social media savvy§ §Enjoy working with technology and in understanding how the technology works from a clients perspective§ §Have the ability to build productive, professional relationships both internally and externally§ §Have excellent soft skills online and in-person (empathy, good listening skills, and adaptability)§ §Be comfortable with the tools of the trade, including graphics, presentations, data, and copyrighting§ §Be capable of building branded collateral, PowerPoints, newsletters, etc§ §Be a good human being for your audience on behalf of our brand§ §Where?§ §Portainer is a global company with employees spread across the world.  We've invested heavily to ensure that geography doesn't get in our way, and we plan to expand our global footprint rapidly over the coming months.   However given the nature of the job and the need to be close to the founders, the development team, and others we are looking for a New Zealand based person.  However, for the right candidate, Portainer.io will offer a sponsored work visa, allowing you to live and work in New Zealand. Consider it a perk of the job!§ §Why?§ §Portainer is already exploding; however, we're still very much in our infancy.  We are hugely excited about our launch into the commercial world, and we believe we're at the start of a wild ride.  Joining Portainer as our §Digital Marketing and Community Manager§ will give you:§ § §The opportunity to play an instrumental role in shaping a truly disruptive company at the beginning of its journey.§ §A great remuneration package§ §The flexibility to work remotely (but based in New Zealand) as part of a world-class team working on great tech§ §The opportunity to spend time or live in New Zealand, if not the best country in the world, then the best country for the world.§ § §About us:§ §Hundreds of thousands of organisations around the world have turned to Portainer to help them manage their container platforms.  With deployments in almost every country of the world, and at a scale from very small to impressively large, Portainer has become synonymous with our catchphrase of "expert simplicity".  Our goal is to provide the most user-friendly means to manage your micro-service platform, regardless of orchestrator, cloud provider, or underlying technology.§§§§

It means we look at the world differently. It's this constant questioning that helps us re-imagine energy, from new ways to create it, to better ways to manage it. Our aim? To create a brighter, more energy efficient future where we put control in our customers' hands.§About the role:§To support this vision, we're on the hunt for a Digital Channel Manager to lead the digital marketing and content roadmap and activities for Genesis' two brands, Genesis and Energy Online. You will support and lead the delivery of compelling, connected customer interactions, with strong commercial results. You will help drive the digital marketing strategy to ensure digital outputs align with business objectives, while leading a team of engaged, motivated and creative digital marketing professionals.§Responsibilities:§Support and drive digital marketing and/or wider business projects to deliver enhanced capability, efficiency, and cost savings in digital marketing channels.§Champion driving in-house digital production and own in-house creative and content production processes.§Ownership of the delivery and creation of marketing comms emails that are not driven through Marketing Automation development.§Drive the digital profit driven marketing programme ensuring quality in creative execution and testing support to maximise results, working closely with Digital Sales Manager and media partners.§Deliver compelling and creatively excellent digital customer interactions while maintaining an omni-channel focus.§Guardianship over creative excellence across digital marketing channels, ensuring consistency with other channels and brands.§Inspire, mentor, and develop a highly skilled team of digital marketing professionals. Owning your work and delivering quality to deadline is what you're known for. We are looking for a confident professional who takes ownership of challenges, works collaboratively with stakeholders, seeks to understand, thrives under pressure, manages expectations, and brings creative flair.§Our Culture:§Here at Genesis you'll find a dynamic and supportive working environment where you can join a diverse team of committed and talented people. We provide our staff with competitive packages, ongoing development and learning opportunities, we support flexible working, diversity and inclusiveness and no corporate suits required here - jeans are welcome every day with our 'dress for your day' policy. If this sounds like you, please apply online.§Please note, we are relocating to Wynyard Quarter in October.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

people in our region and include infrastructure development, community recreational facilities and planning, building and other regulatory services.§The Role§The Upper Clutha Liaison Manager will be responsible for liaising with and supporting the Wānaka Community Board and providing a direct line of communication between the Wānaka Community Board, Wānaka Councillors and key QLDC employees. Effective relationship management with be central to the role in building a collaborative network within QLDC to seek a timely response to issues and enquiries. §The role will also be accountable for operational management of the Governance team, providing support to ensure they continue to operate effectively. §The successful candidate will be required to work primarily in the Wānaka office with regular time spent in the Queenstown office. §Key areas of responsibility§  §Community Support§  §Communication§  §Relationship Management§  §Customer Service§About you §To be successful in this role, you will have: §  §A bachelor degree in a relevant discipline (political sciences, governance, policy or strategic development)§  §5+ years’ experience or operating in an operational, managerial, facilitation, community liaison or senior communication related role§  §Proven experience leading and managing a team §  §The ability to persuade and influence to obtain optimal outcomes §  §A generalist with the ability to represent the Council’s ‘can do’ attitude, whilst acting in a considered and professional manner§  §Proven track record of developing and maintaining relationships across a broad range of stakeholders§  §Highly motivated, achievement-oriented and innovative mind set§In return the successful candidate will receive;§  §Competitive market remuneration§  §Career progression and training opportunities§  §Subsidised health insurance §  §Discounted health and fitness club rates at our great facilities§  §Relocation allowance will be considered for the right candidate§To find out more, or to apply, please go to https://qldc.qjumpersjobs.co/ §Applications close: Friday, 9 October. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §QLDC---Role-Description---Upper-Clutha-Liaison-Manager.pdf§,§QLDC---Role-Description---Upper-Clutha-Liaison-Manager.pdf§§§§

jobTitle: Communications Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629121.txt	§Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Mana Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Communications Manager§ §The role can be based anywhere in NZ with robust internet service and direct air links to Christchurch, Wellington and Auckland. Travel will likely be required occasionally between the cities and to other community and social housing sites around New Zealand in support of the sector’s communications and stakeholder initiatives.§  §Prior experience working in bi-cultural frameworks and looking to take the next step of your communications career into a national level position?§ § §Experience working with news media, issuing media releases, and responding to media requests for information.§ §Have the skills to find and tell compelling stories?§ §An instinct for assessing and managing reputational risk?§ §Community Housing Aotearoa (CHA) is a peak body for New Zealand’s community housing sector. Advocating on the sector’s behalf to Government and others, the organisation builds the reputation of the sector by showcasing its achievements and reinforcing its business and community models. Successfully delivering a responsive housing system, increasing supply of adequate homes and working with quality providers have all attributed to the delivery of better resident and community outcomes CHA is a member driven organisation and is governed by an elected Council representing member providers, with over 110 member organisations including Iwi, Māori and Pasifika  organisations.  CHA works collaboratively with Te Matapihi he Tirohanga mō te Iwi Trust (Te Matapihi) the peak body for Māori housing providers to form an innovative, sustainable and people focused result for the long term.§  §The creation of the Communications Manager position reflects the sector’s determination to communicate with stakeholders and influencers in more effective ways. Helping secure lasting benefits, the manager will interact with a range of people from the many different organisations who make up the sector but also with influencers from central and local government and the private sector.  Engaging with national and local news media to achieve positive coverage of the community housing sector and the CHA strategic goals, this position will design campaigns to promote the sector and garner support, assist in the management of strategic relationships, and utilise creative channels, to help tell the sector’s stories.§  §Maintaining social media and website communication, writing briefing materials for journalists, politicians, government officials and presenting and pitching stories and messages to a range of influential stakeholders will require some years within the sector. The position is pitched to attract candidates who are ready, and skilled to step up into a national role for the first time.  Maintaining the community housing sector brands held by CHA, you will be able to demonstrate desire to help community housing providers get All New Zealanders well-housed.§  §A basic understanding of the housing sector in New Zealand is required, and prior experience working in bi-cultural frameworks, within Te Ao Māori, Iwi or Māori organisations, is highly desirable. With an instinct for assessing and managing reputational risk and demonstrating the skills able to work to deadlines and stay on top of multiple projects at any given time is key to your success in this role. The ability to brief and work with agencies such as videographers, photographers, and designers to help create compelling communications is also required.§  §Skills, experience, and knowledge required will include:§ § §Capability working in media and communications, with a housing, homelessness, or related service lens.§ §Experience working with news media, issuing media releases, and responding to media requests for information.§ §A good understanding of the New Zealand media landscape and ability to develop good connections with national and local media.§ §Prior experience working in bi-cultural frameworks.§ §Ability to build effective, sustainable, and productive relationships, with particularly media and press secretaries.§ §The proven ability to communicate with ease and skills to adapt to your audience.§ §A competency in Te Reo Māori and tikanga Māori and the skill to champion cultural appropriateness throughout your work.§ §An appreciation and interest in political, policy and legislative developments across the public sector and how they interact and affect the community housing sector Is required  to help increase effectiveness in providing appropriate housing and support for Māori and Pasifika designed and  led initiatives.  As such your personal mana, humility and cultural competency will be well placed, sustained, and nurtured.§  §A degree level qualification in a relevant field or equivalent on the job, ‘lived’ experience is required for this position.§  §Salary is positioned to attract those with intermediary communications experience already gained within the sector, and the skills to take the next step into a national level position.§  §To apply, or to enquire further in confidence call or email please contact Heather Walker for a confidential conversation now on §(09) 632 1108§ or email your up-dated CV and covering letter through to heather@manarecruitment.co.nz§  §Applications close Monday 19th of October 2020 at 5.00pm.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing & Communications Coordinator Job in West Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629134.txt	§Marketing & Communications Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing & Communications Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Brannigans Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§West Coast§, §Greymouth§§Salary§§This role is based in Christchurch or Greymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §Marketing & Communications Coordinator §      §        §Our Client§        §Westpower Ltd §is an Electricity Distribution Business, proudly managing and maintaining a successful network providing reliable delivery of electricity and first-class solutions to business and domestic customers throughout the West Coast. Westpower own several electrotechnology companies, including an electrical engineering consultancy (§Mitton ElectroNet§) and contracting businesses (§ElectroNet Services§ and §ElectroNet Transmission§) that provide services across the electricity supply chain throughout New Zealand and Australia.  For more information visit §www.westpower.co.nz§        §The Role §        §Reporting to the CEO§ this new role is responsible for leading the coordination and implementation of activities derived from the marketing and brand management strategies of Westpower across the group of businesses. This role will work closely with the Leadership Team and external marketing suppliers in support of business development programmes to achieve the marketing and communication goals. This role involves building brand integrity, developing plans and budgets, monitoring progress and performance, optimising marketing and branding outcomes, and leading effective public relations communications with stakeholders across the group of businesses.§        §Your Skills and Experience§        §To succeed in this role§ you will have proven experience in planning, coordinating and delivering marketing and communication strategy activities, incorporating design, digital marketing and brand management. You will know how to improve customer connections through online and digital marketing channels and understand how to communicate value propositions that drive business growth. You will be skilled in the use of market analysis and consumer research tools. You will have strong communication skills, build effective relationships, show a high level of professionalism, and demonstrate the confidence to achieve commercial results in a complex, multi faceted business. A relevant tertiary qualification is desirable, as well as a solutions-based focus and commitment to the company’s core values.§        §A Position Description for the role is available for download § here.§        §To Apply§        §To take advantage of this exciting opportunity within a dynamic company, please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate ‘Apply’ button. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Nick Carter on §03 345 8764§ or Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8757§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Our Client§  §Westpower Ltd §is an Electricity Distribution Business, proudly managing and maintaining a successful network providing reliable delivery of electricity and first-class solutions to business and domestic customers throughout the West Coast. Westpower own several electrotechnology companies, including an electrical engineering consultancy (§Mitton ElectroNet§) and contracting businesses (§ElectroNet Services§ and §ElectroNet Transmission§) that provide services across the electricity supply chain throughout New Zealand and Australia.  For more information visit §www.westpower.co.nz§  §The Role §  §Reporting to the CEO§ this new role is responsible for leading the coordination and implementation of activities derived from the marketing and brand management strategies of Westpower across the group of businesses. This role will work closely with the Leadership Team and external marketing suppliers in support of business development programmes to achieve the marketing and communication goals. This role involves building brand integrity, developing plans and budgets, monitoring progress and performance, optimising marketing and branding outcomes, and leading effective public relations communications with stakeholders across the group of businesses.§  §Your Skills and Experience§  §To succeed in this role§ you will have proven experience in planning, coordinating and delivering marketing and communication strategy activities, incorporating design, digital marketing and brand management. You will know how to improve customer connections through online and digital marketing channels and understand how to communicate value propositions that drive business growth. You will be skilled in the use of market analysis and consumer research tools. You will have strong communication skills, build effective relationships, show a high level of professionalism, and demonstrate the confidence to achieve commercial results in a complex, multi faceted business. A relevant tertiary qualification is desirable, as well as a solutions-based focus and commitment to the company’s core values.§  §A Position Description for the role is available for download § here.§  §To Apply§  §To take advantage of this exciting opportunity within a dynamic company, please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate ‘Apply’ button. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Nick Carter on §03 345 8764§ or Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8757§.§§§§

jobTitle: Internal Communications Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629293.txt	§Internal Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Internal Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Vocus Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Internal Communications Manager §      §        §At Vocus, we are on the lookout for a passionate internal communications manager who thrives on engaging colleagues with awesome and effective comms.§        §Internal communication is vital in our work from anywhere model, on any given day we could have people working from all corners of the country as well as our main offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. They work across a range of household brands, including Slingshot, Orcon, Flip and Stuff Fibre, as well as for Enterprise and Government customers under the Vocus banner. Our staff are diverse, so clear, engaging and timely comms are vital.§        §We have built a great team environment with a fun and go-getting culture, we maintain a lively and dynamic environment with regular team events, an active social club and some awesome benefits.§        §You'll need to work across platforms and mediums, knowing which tool is right for the job - whether that's Slack, email, events or presentations. You'll work directly with members of the Executive and Human Resources, to make sure speeches, presentations and written comms are excellent and fit for purpose.§        §You'll develop and own the company's intranet strategy, from inception to execution and ongoing management.§        §You will report directly to the Head of Communications, so occasionally you may help out on external comms and other things too - it's fast-paced and never boring, we promise.§        §What do you bring to the party:§        §          §You'll need to be organised, self-motivated, and collaborative.§          §We expect you to have three years plus experience in journalism, PR, or an in-house comms role§          §Experience with intranets and digital platforms§          §Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills§          §Ability to engage and influence stakeholders across the business§          §Ability to thrive under pressure and manage competing priorities§          §You don't have to have a background in telco, but you'll need to be passionate about technology and challenger brands in a highly competitive market.§        §        §What we bring to the party§        §          §Work with awesome people§          §$80 monthly credit towards Slingshot or Orcon services§          §Flexibility to work from home§          §$300 gym subsidy§          §50% subsidy on health insurance premiums for eligible full-time team members§          §Volunteer days§        §        §Got the skills and the drive to join the team? Get a cover letter, your CV and some examples of your work together and apply today!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Vocus, we are on the lookout for a passionate internal communications manager who thrives on engaging colleagues with awesome and effective comms.§Internal communication is vital in our work from anywhere model, on any given day we could have people working from all corners of the country as well as our main offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. They work across a range of household brands, including Slingshot, Orcon, Flip and Stuff Fibre, as well as for Enterprise and Government customers under the Vocus banner. Our staff are diverse, so clear, engaging and timely comms are vital.§We have built a great team environment with a fun and go-getting culture, we maintain a lively and dynamic environment with regular team events, an active social club and some awesome benefits.§You'll need to work across platforms and mediums, knowing which tool is right for the job - whether that's Slack, email, events or presentations. You'll work directly with members of the Executive and Human Resources, to make sure speeches, presentations and written comms are excellent and fit for purpose.§You'll develop and own the company's intranet strategy, from inception to execution and ongoing management.§You will report directly to the Head of Communications, so occasionally you may help out on external comms and other things too - it's fast-paced and never boring, we promise.§What do you bring to the party:§You'll need to be organised, self-motivated, and collaborative.§We expect you to have three years plus experience in journalism, PR, or an in-house comms role§Experience with intranets and digital platforms§Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills§Ability to engage and influence stakeholders across the business§Ability to thrive under pressure and manage competing priorities§You don't have to have a background in telco, but you'll need to be passionate about technology and challenger brands in a highly competitive market.§What we bring to the party§Work with awesome people§$80 monthly credit towards Slingshot or Orcon services§Flexibility to work from home§$300 gym subsidy§50% subsidy on health insurance premiums for eligible full-time team members§Volunteer days§Got the skills and the drive to join the team? Get a cover letter, your CV and some examples of your work together and apply today!§§§§

Westpower own several electrotechnology companies, including an electrical engineering consultancy (§Mitton ElectroNet§) and contracting businesses (§ElectroNet Services§ and §ElectroNet Transmission§) that provide services across the electricity supply chain throughout New Zealand and Australia.  For more information visit §www.westpower.co.nz§ §The Role § §Reporting to the CEO§ this new role is responsible for leading the coordination and implementation of activities derived from the marketing and brand management strategies of Westpower across the group of businesses. This role will work closely with the Leadership Team and external marketing suppliers in support of business development programmes to achieve the marketing and communication goals. This role involves building brand integrity, developing plans and budgets, monitoring progress and performance, optimising marketing and branding outcomes, and leading effective public relations communications with stakeholders across the group of businesses.§ §Your Skills and Experience§ §To succeed in this role§ you will have proven experience in planning, coordinating and delivering marketing and communication strategy activities, incorporating design, digital marketing and brand management. You will know how to improve customer connections through online and digital marketing channels and understand how to communicate value propositions that drive business growth. You will be skilled in the use of market analysis and consumer research tools. You will have strong communication skills, build effective relationships, show a high level of professionalism, and demonstrate the confidence to achieve commercial results in a complex, multi faceted business. A relevant tertiary qualification is desirable, as well as a solutions-based focus and commitment to the company’s core values.§ §A Position Description for the role is available for download § here.§ §To Apply§ §To take advantage of this exciting opportunity within a dynamic company, please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate ‘Apply’ button. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Nick Carter on §03 345 8764§ or Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8757§.§§§§

jobTitle: Communications and Marketing Manager - Infrastructure Projects (Auckland) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630257.txt	§Communications and Marketing Manager - Infrastructure Projects (Auckland)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications and Marketing Manager - Infrastructure Projects (Auckland)§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Communications and Marketing Manager - Infrastructure Projects (Auckland) §      §        §Downer’s Infrastructure Projects division delivers multi-disciplined infrastructure solutions throughout New Zealand and the South Pacific, in the road, rail, renewable, water and civil sectors. We’ve had some great successes in the past couple of years and are currently delivering a number of major infrastructure projects which will change the face of Auckland and New Zealand – including the City Rail Link projects, America’s Cup project, the Downtown Infrastructure Programme and the Christchurch Southern Motorway.§        §To respond to some exciting opportunities through 2020 and beyond, we now have a fantastic newly created part time opportunity (30 hours per week) for an experienced Communications and Marketing Manager to join our high performing team. With a healthy pipeline of high value opportunities, this is an exciting time for you to continue your learning and development, while using your existing skillset and experience in the communication and marketing space.§        §About the role:§        §This role will be based at our Parnell office and will work within the Infrastructure Projects business unit. The role will work closely with the Senior Leadership team and the National Communications & Brand team to deliver customised and engaging messages for both our internal and external audiences. The role will also be responsible for developing, implementing and driving communication strategies and initiatives that support a dynamic and innovative culture tailored to our project-led and customer-centric business.§        §About you: §You will have a recognised tertiary qualification in Communications or Marketing with a minimum of 4 years communication experience. In addition, it is preferred you have experience using Microsoft Office applications as well as Adobe Creative Suite (particularly InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator).§        §We are looking for an innovative and passionate individual who has a background in communications and marketing with a large multi-stakeholder organisation. As part of your experience, you should have strong leadership experience along with a high level of communication, interpersonal and organisational expertise. This is a varied and busy environment that requires high levels of motivation and relationship skills.§        §Along with your CV, please provide a cover letter which convinces us that you have the right skills, experience and attitude to exceed.§        §Don't delay! Apply now by visiting www.downercareers.co.nz reference 573757§        §The successful applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug test & medical.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer’s Infrastructure Projects division delivers multi-disciplined infrastructure solutions throughout New Zealand and the South Pacific, in the road, rail, renewable, water and civil sectors. We’ve had some great successes in the past couple of years and are currently delivering a number of major infrastructure projects which will change the face of Auckland and New Zealand – including the City Rail Link projects, America’s Cup project, the Downtown Infrastructure Programme and the Christchurch Southern Motorway.§To respond to some exciting opportunities through 2020 and beyond, we now have a fantastic newly created part time opportunity (30 hours per week) for an experienced Communications and Marketing Manager to join our high performing team. With a healthy pipeline of high value opportunities, this is an exciting time for you to continue your learning and development, while using your existing skillset and experience in the communication and marketing space.§About the role:§This role will be based at our Parnell office and will work within the Infrastructure Projects business unit. The role will work closely with the Senior Leadership team and the National Communications & Brand team to deliver customised and engaging messages for both our internal and external audiences. The role will also be responsible for developing, implementing and driving communication strategies and initiatives that support a dynamic and innovative culture tailored to our project-led and customer-centric business.§About you: §You will have a recognised tertiary qualification in Communications or Marketing with a minimum of 4 years communication experience. In addition, it is preferred you have experience using Microsoft Office applications as well as Adobe Creative Suite (particularly InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator).§We are looking for an innovative and passionate individual who has a background in communications and marketing with a large multi-stakeholder organisation. As part of your experience, you should have strong leadership experience along with a high level of communication, interpersonal and organisational expertise. This is a varied and busy environment that requires high levels of motivation and relationship skills.§Along with your CV, please provide a cover letter which convinces us that you have the right skills, experience and attitude to exceed.§Don't delay! Apply now by visiting www.downercareers.co.nz reference 573757§The successful applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug test & medical.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Communications Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630655.txt	§Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Site Safe§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Communications Advisor §      §        §Site Safe is a not-for-profit membership organisation that promotes, inspires and supports health and safety in New Zealand construction. §        §We offer a wide range of products and services including NZQA-approved health and safety training, safety reviews, free guides and resources to ensure everyone is kept up-to-date with easy, accessible health and safety information. Together we are ‘Proud to be Safe’. §        §Right now our Marketing and Communications team needs some help! We are looking for a full time Communications Advisor to join our team. §        §With lots of projects on the go, here is your chance to grow your communications, PR and media skills. This is an intermediate level role and would ideally suit someone with 2+ years of communications experience under their belt. §        §As part of a small team we are looking for someone who isn’t afraid to roll their sleeves up and who can: §        §          §            §Provide communications planning and implementation for key projects and events. §          §          §            §Be our “chief copywriter” creating content, articles, case studies, newsletters, speeches and other essential material. §          §          §            §Help us raise the profile of Site Safe by supporting our Chief Executive, identifying story ideas, writing media releases and opinion pieces. §          §          §            §Work across the organisation and with the Leadership Team to support internal communications including plans and key messaging.  §          §        §        §          §            §Support our Marketing Advisor with content and back-up for social media management. §          §        §        §In return we’ll offer you a chance to make a real difference and work with a fun and tight knit team.  We are based in Ngauranga – there are frequent trains and buses from Wellington CBD, however if you drive, then parking is free!  We’re also a flexible employer and offer health and life insurance benefits.   §        §If this sounds like you, get in touch, we’d love to hear from you today!  §        §The job description is available on our website, https://www.sitesafe.org.nz/about-us/working-with-site-safe/  §        §For further details or a confidential chat please contact Sarah Prior on §(04) 815 8840§ or 027 435 4957. §        §Applications close 5pm, Monday 5 October 2020. §        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Site Safe is a not-for-profit membership organisation that promotes, inspires and supports health and safety in New Zealand construction. § §We offer a wide range of products and services including NZQA-approved health and safety training, safety reviews, free guides and resources to ensure everyone is kept up-to-date with easy, accessible health and safety information. Together we are ‘Proud to be Safe’. § §Right now our Marketing and Communications team needs some help! We are looking for a full time Communications Advisor to join our team. § §With lots of projects on the go, here is your chance to grow your communications, PR and media skills. This is an intermediate level role and would ideally suit someone with 2+ years of communications experience under their belt. § §As part of a small team we are looking for someone who isn’t afraid to roll their sleeves up and who can: § § § §Provide communications planning and implementation for key projects and events. § § § §Be our “chief copywriter” creating content, articles, case studies, newsletters, speeches and other essential material. § § § §Help us raise the profile of Site Safe by supporting our Chief Executive, identifying story ideas, writing media releases and opinion pieces. § § § §Work across the organisation and with the Leadership Team to support internal communications including plans and key messaging.  § § § §Support our Marketing Advisor with content and back-up for social media management. § § §In return we’ll offer you a chance to make a real difference and work with a fun and tight knit team.  We are based in Ngauranga – there are frequent trains and buses from Wellington CBD, however if you drive, then parking is free!  We’re also a flexible employer and offer health and life insurance benefits.   § §If this sounds like you, get in touch, we’d love to hear from you today!  § §The job description is available on our website, https://www.sitesafe.org.nz/about-us/working-with-site-safe/  § §For further details or a confidential chat please contact Sarah Prior on §(04) 815 8840§ or 027 435 4957. § §Applications close 5pm, Monday 5 October 2020. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a communications adviser?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50631132.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Adecco Sales & Marketing§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Marketing Executive §      §        §Steelfort is a well-established and respected, privately owned company with a diverse range of retail and commercial products. Their head office is based in Palmerston North and the two segments of this company are its range of Outdoor Power Equipment and associated products, and its commercial range of manufactured equipment.§        §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing Executive to join this highly successful market leader. Reporting directly to, and supporting the General Manager (Sales & Marketing), the main objective is to develop and implement all aspects of the company’s marketing requirements and strategies.§        §Their marketing strategy is well proven; however this position will have the autonomy to develop new and exciting strategies whilst being involved in traditional marketing activities.§        §The key responsibilities of the role include:§        §          §Planning and managing the marketing strategy of events and activities for existing and new products§          §The creation of marketing collateral, advertising material and other promotional material§          §Website management including content and site platforms; both internal and external portals§          §Managing social media and monitoring online marketing performance§          §Working closely with the General Manager to co-ordinate the marketing plans for the company and generate a strategy that will have positive results for all divisions§        §        §To be successful you will ideally have:§        §          §Tertiary qualification in Marketing or Business discipline§          §Proven experience in a similar role§          §High business acumen§          §You will be a self-starter with a positive attitude and lots of energy!§        §        §          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§          §Strong relationship building skills with the ability to relate to a wide range of people§          §Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher & PhotoShop§        §        §This is a pivotal role in their organisation therefore we are looking for someone who has previous experience working in a business/corporate environment who has strong business communication skills with a high level of professionalism.§        §If you want to me part of this highly professional company then act now and apply on-line with a Cover Letter and updated CV or for further information please contact Sarah Wright at Adecco on §06 357 2020§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Steelfort is a well-established and respected, privately owned company with a diverse range of retail and commercial products. Their head office is based in Palmerston North and the two segments of this company are its range of Outdoor Power Equipment and associated products, and its commercial range of manufactured equipment.§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing Executive to join this highly successful market leader. Reporting directly to, and supporting the General Manager (Sales & Marketing), the main objective is to develop and implement all aspects of the company’s marketing requirements and strategies.§Their marketing strategy is well proven; however this position will have the autonomy to develop new and exciting strategies whilst being involved in traditional marketing activities.§The key responsibilities of the role include:§Planning and managing the marketing strategy of events and activities for existing and new products§The creation of marketing collateral, advertising material and other promotional material§Website management including content and site platforms; both internal and external portals§Managing social media and monitoring online marketing performance§Working closely with the General Manager to co-ordinate the marketing plans for the company and generate a strategy that will have positive results for all divisions§To be successful you will ideally have:§Tertiary qualification in Marketing or Business discipline§Proven experience in a similar role§High business acumen§You will be a self-starter with a positive attitude and lots of energy!§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Strong relationship building skills with the ability to relate to a wide range of people§Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher & PhotoShop§This is a pivotal role in their organisation therefore we are looking for someone who has previous experience working in a business/corporate environment who has strong business communication skills with a high level of professionalism.§If you want to me part of this highly professional company then act now and apply on-line with a Cover Letter and updated CV or for further information please contact Sarah Wright at Adecco on §06 357 2020§.§§§§
