jobText: TXT/50663224.txt	§Marketing Manager - The Palms§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager - The Palms§§Advertiser: §AMP Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Competitive Salary Range§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Marketing Manager - The Palms §      §        §AMP Capital§        §AMP Capital is a global investment management business and is with a diversified asset class mix. As part of the AMP Group, we share a heritage that spans over 160 years. Our home strength in Australia and New Zealand has enabled us to grow internationally, and today we have operations established in the Middle East, China, Hong Kong, India, Ireland, Japan, Luxembourg, the United Kingdom and the United States. We also collaborate with a network of global investment partners, leveraging our shared capabilities to provide greater access to new investment opportunities.§        §Our asset class specialists, investment strategists and economists work together with the aim of delivering strong investment outcomes for clients. That is why our clients trust us to invest over A$200 billion (as at 30 June 2019) on their behalf, across a range of single sector and diversified funds.§        § §        §AMP Capital Shopping Centres§        §The Real Estate is responsible for managing AMP Capital’s substantial property business. This includes the investment management of AMP capital’s various property portfolios; the day – to – day management of the office, industrial and shopping centre properties in which AMP Capital invests; and researching new property opportunities.§        §AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§        §AMPCSC has a broad portfolio of Shopping Centres and it operates across Australia and New Zealand.§        § §        §Purpose of the role§        §To maximise the value of the centre through creating, implementing and managing strategic marketing initiatives which drive overall centre performance.§        § §        §What the role entails:§        §          §Develop and deliver the marketing plan and budget annually ensuring alignment with the centre’s key focus areas, meet the objectives of the asset plans and business plan, and inline with the asset lifecycle.§          §Plan and implement marketing strategies and programs that are maximising customer traffic flow that will give the retailers the opportunity to maximise sales.§          §Ensure all key stakeholders are briefed on all activation/events/campaigns and that all health and safety policies and procedures are adhered to, including identifying and reducing any risks§          §Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the centre’s key issues, competitor activity, trade area demographics and trading patterns – including relevancy to national trends.§          §A thorough understanding of the development approach to develop and deliver development marketing strategies to meet objectives for each phase, pre-launch, launch and stabilisation.§          §The marketing manager is also a key member of centre management leadership team and will be actively involved in the day to day operation of the centre. This includes involvement in and responsibility for total asset performance and net operating income.§        §        § §        §Capabilities:§        §          §Shopping centre, property or retail industry experience  §          §5+ years’ experience in a marketing or communication role§          §Marketing or Communications degree or similar qualification§          §Excellent written communication skills – business, presentation, social and corporate§          §Leadership and people management skills§          §Operational Centre Marketing strategy and planning skills§        §        § §        § §        §Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. Should we require assistance we may reach out to our network of preferred agency partners once this ad has expired. This includes the investment management of AMP capital’s various property portfolios; the day – to – day management of the office, industrial and shopping centre properties in which AMP Capital invests; and researching new property opportunities.§AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§AMPCSC has a broad portfolio of Shopping Centres and it operates across Australia and New Zealand.§ §Purpose of the role§To maximise the value of the centre through creating, implementing and managing strategic marketing initiatives which drive overall centre performance.§ §What the role entails:§§Develop and deliver the marketing plan and budget annually ensuring alignment with the centre’s key focus areas, meet the objectives of the asset plans and business plan, and inline with the asset lifecycle.§Plan and implement marketing strategies and programs that are maximising customer traffic flow that will give the retailers the opportunity to maximise sales.§Ensure all key stakeholders are briefed on all activation/events/campaigns and that all health and safety policies and procedures are adhered to, including identifying and reducing any risks§Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the centre’s key issues, competitor activity, trade area demographics and trading patterns – including relevancy to national trends.§A thorough understanding of the development approach to develop and deliver development marketing strategies to meet objectives for each phase, pre-launch, launch and stabilisation.§The marketing manager is also a key member of centre management leadership team and will be actively involved in the day to day operation of the centre. jobText: TXT/50663832.txt	§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Micrographic Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§ §  §Marketing and Communications Coordinator§  §As the Marketing and Communications Coordinator, you will support two companies - Recollect and NZMS. You will be responsible for implementing each of their digital marketing programs, driving the digital narrative to enhance each organisation's brand, coordinating digital communications to clients, and encouraging business growth through effective marketing and communications. Your main purpose will be to assist with the development and implementation of marketing plans to support brand awareness and sales strategies, both locally and globally. §  §About the companies §  §Recollect, is a cloud-based community engagement platform (SaaS), that hosts our customers’ cultural heritage digital reproductions and we have built up an enviable reputation in the market.  This unique product has been developed in-house and we are currently taking this product worldwide. For more information please refer to: www.recollectcms.com§  §NZMS is New Zealand’s leading digitisation and imaging bureau for cultural heritage materials such as photographs, manuscripts, publications, maps, works of art, and audio-visual records.  We work primarily with galleries, libraries, archives, and museums throughout New Zealand, our clients also include government agencies, private companies, iwi, and individuals.  We have offices in Wellington (2), Auckland, and Christchurch. For more information please refer to: www.micrographics.co.nz§  §This position will be responsible for:§  §Marketing Coordination§ § §Creating and implementing effective marketing plans and campaigns for various projects and products to achieve inbound enquiry targets and improve brand awareness.§ §Developing campaign ideas and messaging tailored for each company and integrating these across multiple channels.§ §Creating engaging and consistent content for multiple social media channels and platforms.§ §Collaborating closely with internal operations, sales teams, external stakeholders, and customers.§ §Tracking, analysing and reporting regularly on various metrics.§ §Assisting market and persona research to aid project and campaign development.§ §Monitoring industry activity while researching opportunities and marketing innovations.§ §Maintaining the brand equity and ensure all marketing and communications is in line with the brand values of each company.§ §Communications§ § §Ensuring that the content of our various brand websites remain current and accurately reflects Recollect and NZMS’ individual products, services and values.§ §Overseeing social media for each organisation including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.§ §Creating customer communications to ensure they remain informed of key activities.§ §Overseeing production of regular newsletters.§ §Supporting and delivering the marketing requirements for key areas of each business.§ §Identifying projects for case studies and blog posts. Be comfortable working with customers to generate content that is beneficial to both parties.§ §Planning, creating and coordinating marketing campaigns and collateral to a high standard.§ §Working closely with internal and external stakeholders to build strong business relationships and create effective marketing initiatives.§ §Supporting other projects as required by NZMS and Recollect.§ §Event Support§ §Supporting each organisations presence at key events throughout the year including industry conferences and events.§ §Person Specification§ § §Enjoys a collaborative environment and the exchange of ideas.§ §Has initiative; can identify opportunities and risks and solve problems.§ §A self-starter, who can manage their own programme of work and has a proven record of delivery to deadlines.§ §Able to communicate well with internal and external clients from a range of backgrounds.§ §Has integrity and builds trust with clients and colleagues.§ §Exceptional business communication skills both oral and written.§ §Can work with multiple brands, their strategies and guidelines.§ §A flair for design, with experience in Adobe Creative Cloud suite desirable.§ §Highly organised and able to multitask, delivering to multiple deadlines.§ §Able to build strong business relationships with others in different locations.§ §Ambition and desire to deliver outstanding results.§ §Proactive, unflappable and hard working.§ §Skills & Experience§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification in marketing and communications, or equivalent level of skill gained through on the job training and experience.§ §Entry level  position § §Experience in planning, creating and coordinating marketing campaigns.§ §Experience with Mailchimp or similar platforms (desirable but not essential).§ §NOTE for overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents: only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions. Others should not apply.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50665655.txt	§Brand Development & Graphic Design§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Development & Graphic Design§§Advertiser: §Rocket Lab§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Brand Development & Graphic Design §    §      §About Rocket Lab:§ At Rocket Lab, we believe the future will be defined and enabled by access to space. As a world leader in launch and space systems, we’re making that future a reality and enabling the ideas of tomorrow to reach orbit today. We’re unlocking the potential of space and ushering in a new era of opportunity and exploration for the benefit of humankind. §   § §About the Role:§ This is a rare opportunity to drive the brand and creative direction of one of the most iconic and respected brands in the space industry. Based at Rocket Lab’s Auckland Production Complex in New Zealand, the Brand Development & Graphic Design role will support the Communications team in developing industry-leading design assets. From designing limited edition merchandise that sells out in minutes, to creating customer-facing collateral that inspires, this role is responsible for visually articulating Rocket Lab’s story to the world.§   § We’re already leading an industry, but we’re not even close to done yet. Soon we’re embarking on a mission to the Moon for NASA, we’re mounting the first private mission to Venus in search of life, and we’re growing an entirely new space systems division to produce our own spacecraft in-house to support innovation and new capabilities on orbit. You’ll play a pivotal part in bringing these history-making missions and programs to life with creative assets and concepts. Now’s your chance to make your mark on missions that will be remembered for generations.§   § Space has never looked so good, but can you make it look even better? Then we want you on our team. §   § §Your mission: §        §          §Support the Communications team in producing design assets across multiple platforms (print, social media, customer and internal-facing collateral, merchandising, digital, and experiential)§          §Consistently elevate the visual aesthetic of the Rocket Lab brand§          §Drive the creative process from design to execution on internal and external facing projects§          §Manage projects ranging from simple design requests to managing complex experiential projects§          §Respond to creative briefs from across the business, and also proactively drive creative campaigns and initiatives§          §Identify and manage suppliers and contractors to deliver brand assets incl. signage, merchandise, printing on time and on budget§          §Develop strong relationships across the company to enable collaboration and the best possible creative outputs§        § §You will have:§        §          §5+ years of design experience in graphic design§          §Tertiary qualification in graphic design, media/digital art, advertising, marketing or a similar field§          §An impressive portfolio showcasing a broad variety of design work§          §Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite software (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) and in Microsoft Office Suite§          §A sharp eye for quality§          §Resourcefulness and ability develop creative concepts both independently and collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders§          §Ability to multi-task across multiple projects§          §Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills§          §Ability to take things in stride and maintain composure in an ever changing, fast paced environment§          §Ability to stay organized, meet deadlines, and prioritize projects based on business requirements§          §A strategic mind that ensures design outputs support overarching business objectives§          §Ability to transition with ease from presenting ideas and concepts in the boardroom, to diving deep into the detail while executing the work§          §Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required (to rocket factories and launch pads!)§        §   § §Bonus points if you:§        §          §Have experience in both video and/or still camera operation, direction, production coordination and post-production editing§          §Have website design experience§          §Love all things space§        § §Important Information § For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.  These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.  Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.  For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.§      §      §Ciara Byrne §    §  §§§About Rocket Lab:§ At Rocket Lab, we believe the future will be defined and enabled by access to space. jobTitle: Senior Communications Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666021.txt	§Senior Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Fixed-term, 18 months§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About our group and team§ELSA - Early Learning and Student Achievement§At the heart of our work is making sure that every day, in every early learning service, kōhanga reo, school, and kura, the education workforce and curriculum delivery is world class, and focused on what New Zealanders need for their best future.§About Pay Equity§The Pay Equity team is responsible for investigating and settling education sector pay equity claims. This is done in accordance with the State Sector Pay Equity Claims Framework and the requirements of the Equal Pay Amendment Act 2020.§Pay equity means that people are paid equally for doing work of equal value. It acknowledges the value of the skills, responsibilities and demands of workers in female dominated occupations that have suffered from gender-based discrimination because of perceptions and prejudices about the value of 'women's work'.§About this role§The Senior Communications Adviser, Pay Equity is responsible for developing engaging content to support a wide range of stakeholders, including schools and kura, education sector employees and the wider community, on the investigation and settlement of Education sector pay equity claims, and the implementation of such settlements.§The Senior Communications Adviser will support the Chief Adviser Communications to develop engaging content, and to assist with the implementation of the change and communications strategies related to pay equity claims.§About you§To be successful in this role, you will be an excellent communicator, with well-developed presentation and writing skills. You will have the ability to take a strategic focus on issues and be adept at meeting strategic and tactical business needs.§You will enjoy working collaboratively in a team environment and have the ability to effectively engage with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.§You will be joining a small team working in a flexible environment.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§There is more information in the position description attached, please take a look and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact Gemma Allen-Collins at§ §gemma.allencollins@education.govt.nz§§Applications close on Monday, 12 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Market Integration Specialist Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666238.txt	§Market Integration Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Market Integration Specialist§§Advertiser: §LIC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §We are kiwi innovators at the forefront of dairy science and we're looking for talented people to lead us to success in our industry.§      §Market Integration Specialist §      §        §About the Role§        §This role is part of the NZ Markets group which operates as the channel to our customers and customer voice.§        §As a Market Integration Specialist you will be responsible for liaising with all relevant key stakeholders, both externally and internally, to drive the development of new farm facing information products; from the validation process through to implementation.§        §This role is fixed term for 12 months and will require some domestic travel. Please ensure this is not a barrier before applying.§        §        §About You§        §Your ability to accurately complete the viability process for new farm facing products, and ensure the end result meets the requirements of the customer is vital for success in this role.§        §It is important that you represent the views and interests of the Customer and NZ Markets group, and ensure that new farm facing products are in line with these requirements.§        §Skills and experience required for this role are:§        §          §Strong empathy with farmers and an affinity for the rural community§          §Power user of the MINDA software and its application in farm management§          §Excellent communication, collaboration, negotiation, influencing and relationship management skills§          §Understanding of the LIC Products and Services§          §Business Planning, writing and documentation experience§          §To be successful at LIC means you'll thrive in a fast-paced, busy environment and you'll be adaptable to change. You'll also enjoy working within a team of dedicated individuals, and be able to deliver a professional approach when working with a wide array of customers.§        §        §        §About Us§        §We all have our improvement stories to tell. At LIC we believe in constant improvement, never settling and always striving for greatness. We know little improvements can add up to huge gains for our customers, and for our country. We value NZ primary industries and will do whatever it takes to support and grow our farmer community. We're down to earth and we're a diverse bunch - a mix of super smart scientists, veterinarians, farmers, sales people and clever marketing folk. We are inclusive and count ourselves lucky to have people from all backgrounds working with us.§        §LIC is based in Newstead, Hamilton, where we enjoy relaxed commuting, easy parking and a readily accessible outdoor lifestyle. Our campus is in a rural setting just outside Hamilton and includes a social club, swimming pool, onsite parking, tennis and volleyball courts and a café with great coffee. We also offer generous sick leave entitlements, flexible work arrangements, extra leave days per year, family leave for new parents, discounted insurance, employee shares scheme, mental health & well-being program, internal training programmes and an employee assistance programme to name but a few - and we're still working on improvements!§        §        §How to Apply§        §If you're after a rewarding and social career with people who embrace our company values of Integrity, Innovation, Spirit of Co-Operation, In-tune and Passion, then we would consider ourselves lucky to welcome you on-board.§        §For more information and to apply, go to our website www.careers.lic.co.nz§        §Job code:§ 37879§        §Applications Close:§ 16 October 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Role§This role is part of the NZ Markets group which operates as the channel to our customers and customer voice.§As a Market Integration Specialist you will be responsible for liaising with all relevant key stakeholders, both externally and internally, to drive the development of new farm facing information products; from the validation process through to implementation.§This role is fixed term for 12 months and will require some domestic travel. Please ensure this is not a barrier before applying.§§About You§Your ability to accurately complete the viability process for new farm facing products, and ensure the end result meets the requirements of the customer is vital for success in this role.§It is important that you represent the views and interests of the Customer and NZ Markets group, and ensure that new farm facing products are in line with these requirements.§Skills and experience required for this role are:§Strong empathy with farmers and an affinity for the rural community§Power user of the MINDA software and its application in farm management§Excellent communication, collaboration, negotiation, influencing and relationship management skills§Understanding of the LIC Products and Services§Business Planning, writing and documentation experience§To be successful at LIC means you'll thrive in a fast-paced, busy environment and you'll be adaptable to change. You'll also enjoy working within a team of dedicated individuals, and be able to deliver a professional approach when working with a wide array of customers.§§About Us§We all have our improvement stories to tell. At LIC we believe in constant improvement, never settling and always striving for greatness. We know little improvements can add up to huge gains for our customers, and for our country. We value NZ primary industries and will do whatever it takes to support and grow our farmer community. We're down to earth and we're a diverse bunch - a mix of super smart scientists, veterinarians, farmers, sales people and clever marketing folk. We are inclusive and count ourselves lucky to have people from all backgrounds working with us.§LIC is based in Newstead, Hamilton, where we enjoy relaxed commuting, easy parking and a readily accessible outdoor lifestyle. Our campus is in a rural setting just outside Hamilton and includes a social club, swimming pool, onsite parking, tennis and volleyball courts and a café with great coffee. We also offer generous sick leave entitlements, flexible work arrangements, extra leave days per year, family leave for new parents, discounted insurance, employee shares scheme, mental health & well-being program, internal training programmes and an employee assistance programme to name but a few - and we're still working on improvements!§§How to Apply§If you're after a rewarding and social career with people who embrace our company values of Integrity, Innovation, Spirit of Co-Operation, In-tune and Passion, then we would consider ourselves lucky to welcome you on-board.§For more information and to apply, go to our website www.careers.lic.co.nz§Job code:§ 37879§Applications Close:§ 16 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Marketing and Communications Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666634.txt	§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Frog Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Marketing and Communications Coordinator §      §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing and Communication coordinator to join the Marketing and Communication team. You will love what you do, working alongside a group of individuals who all have one thing in common, they want to give our kids a great start in life and passionate in helping kiwi kids to reach their potential through the great work they do every day for the community!§ §Reporting to the Marketing Communications Manager, you will focus on the coordination and management of the content calendars and workflows for all digital channels, including Facebook advertising, community comms, reporting of key metrics. You will also be managing the content updates on the website as well as assisting the wider team in delivering the digital communication and acquisition strategy, including SEO and Google AdWords management. §There is no doubt that your previous marketing coordination and strong copy writing skills, excellent time management, and proactive and adept ability to navigate project planning demands will be important here. §Best described as ‘vibrant’, an array of activity will come across your desk; from mini projects, to creating branded collateral eg flyers, posters and  displays which will see your natural flare for driving greater engagement and ensure an exceptional brand experience for all key stakeholders.§ §As a diverse, exciting and heartwarming role, you can look forward to competitive salary, great Albany location and a fantastic career development opportunity if you’re a real self-starter, someone with get-up and-go and willing to roll up your sleeves to help the team. § §Sound like you? To be consider for this great opportunity. Apply today or call Angela at Frog Recruitment on §09 362 0785§ if you have any questions. §      §      §    §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing and Communication coordinator to join the Marketing and Communication team. You will love what you do, working alongside a group of individuals who all have one thing in common, they want to give our kids a great start in life and passionate in helping kiwi kids to reach their potential through the great work they do every day for the community!§ §Reporting to the Marketing Communications Manager, you will focus on the coordination and management of the content calendars and workflows for all digital channels, including Facebook advertising, community comms, reporting of key metrics. You will also be managing the content updates on the website as well as assisting the wider team in delivering the digital communication and acquisition strategy, including SEO and Google AdWords management. §There is no doubt that your previous marketing coordination and strong copy writing skills, excellent time management, and proactive and adept ability to navigate project planning demands will be important here. §Best described as ‘vibrant’, an array of activity will come across your desk; from mini projects, to creating branded collateral eg flyers, posters and  displays which will see your natural flare for driving greater engagement and ensure an exceptional brand experience for all key stakeholders.§ §As a diverse, exciting and heartwarming role, you can look forward to competitive salary, great Albany location and a fantastic career development opportunity if you’re a real self-starter, someone with get-up and-go and willing to roll up your sleeves to help the team. § §Sound like you? To be consider for this great opportunity. Apply today or call Angela at Frog Recruitment on §09 362 0785§ if you have any questions.§§§§

jobTitle: Brand Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50669439.txt	§Brand Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Assistant§§Advertiser: §Frucor Suntory§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Brand Assistant §      §        §From the makers of ‘V’ comes an opportunity not to be missed!§        §Thirsty work happens every day at Frucor Suntory – we are the distributor of some of New Zealand and Australia's most popular beverage brands after all.§        §We make, market and distribute a range of fruit juices, fruit drinks, energy drinks, waters and soft drinks, many of which are household names throughout New Zealand and Australia. Our brands include the iconic ‘V’ energy drink, Fresh Up, Just Juice, Simply Squeezed, the real McCoy, Amplify, h2go, Mizone, NZNatural and Suntory Boss Coffee.§        §Since our beginnings in the early 1960s, Frucor Suntory has evolved from a small New Zealand juice business to a leading Australasian drinks company and the market leader in energy drinks and Juice and New Zealand. We've been part of the leading Japanese beverage and food company Suntory Group since 2009 and in 2017, we became Frucor Suntory. §        §Frucor Suntory offers people an energetic, achievement-focused workplace with plenty of action and a fantastic values based culture. We're passionate and innovative, and we are always on the lookout for ways to do things better – how we make our drinks, look after our people and reduce our environmental footprint.§        §We are “Hungry to make drinks better” and looking to expand our team… §        §This is a great opportunity for a fresh graduate who is looking launch into their first role. You will learn and experience all the facets of marketing ensuring you continue your learning from uni while experiencing the practical side of our business.§        §In this role, you will be provided with an introduction into marketing at Frucor Suntory within one of the need state teams where you will have the chance to champion our brands to achieve corporate sales, share and profit targets. You will work closely with a Senior Brand Manager where they will help develop and execute strategies and annual plans that connect with consumers and generate long term profitable growth for Frucor.§        §Where do you fit in?§        §Here at Frucor Suntory, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and like to have fun but we don’t shy away from a challenge, and neither should you. A lot of what we look for is how you would align with our values ‘Together’, ‘Go For It‘ and ‘Make a Difference’.§        §You will:§        §          §Need to complete a relevant tertiary qualification in 2020§          §Have achieved consistently strong grades – we want to see the results from your dedication and commitment§          §Be a dynamic person who is passionate about marketing, thinks outside the box and thrives at being a part of an innovative and energetic environment§          §Have tonnes of initiative and won’t be afraid to get stuck in and give things a go with a passion for trailblazing ideas while being a part of exciting new solutions§          §Want to go places, so your ability to lead and influence people will be important§        §        §You would have proven you can achieve at uni now come and prove yourself as part of the Frucor team!§        §What can we do for you?§        §We offer a competitive base salary, a day off on your birthday, flexible working hours, study leave and the opportunity to earn an incentive. Working at Frucor Suntory isn't a job, it's a career. We support our people to be their best, and our learning and development opportunities are hard to beat. We share ideas, knowledge and expertise wherever we can to ensure our employees can flourish.§        §This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a great team and use their skills to influence our staff and customers. You will receive a high level of support to learn new skills and enhance your personal development.§        §How do I apply?§        §If you’re passionate about your career and seek a high growth environment, a strong team culture, career advancement and the opportunity to make a real difference to the company’s on-going success, then this is the role for you!§        §Please apply by submitting your CV and cover letter no later than §end of day Sunday 25 October§. Make sure to include in your application how you’re hungry to make drinks better with us!§        §Attention Recruitment Agencies: §Frucor Suntory has a Direct Sourcing model and at this point in time we will not require any recruitment agency support for this role.§      §      §Please note that final applicants will need to undergo a Ministry of Justice security check & a pre-employment drug test. Some roles may also need to undergo a credit check. §    §    §    §    §  §§§From the makers of ‘V’ comes an opportunity not to be missed!§Thirsty work happens every day at Frucor Suntory – we are the distributor of some of New Zealand and Australia's most popular beverage brands after all.§We make, market and distribute a range of fruit juices, fruit drinks, energy drinks, waters and soft drinks, many of which are household names throughout New Zealand and Australia. Our brands include the iconic ‘V’ energy drink, Fresh Up, Just Juice, Simply Squeezed, the real McCoy, Amplify, h2go, Mizone, NZNatural and Suntory Boss Coffee.§Since our beginnings in the early 1960s, Frucor Suntory has evolved from a small New Zealand juice business to a leading Australasian drinks company and the market leader in energy drinks and Juice and New Zealand. We've been part of the leading Japanese beverage and food company Suntory Group since 2009 and in 2017, we became Frucor Suntory. §Frucor Suntory offers people an energetic, achievement-focused workplace with plenty of action and a fantastic values based culture. We're passionate and innovative, and we are always on the lookout for ways to do things better – how we make our drinks, look after our people and reduce our environmental footprint.§We are “Hungry to make drinks better” and looking to expand our team… §This is a great opportunity for a fresh graduate who is looking launch into their first role. You will learn and experience all the facets of marketing ensuring you continue your learning from uni while experiencing the practical side of our business.§In this role, you will be provided with an introduction into marketing at Frucor Suntory within one of the need state teams where you will have the chance to champion our brands to achieve corporate sales, share and profit targets. You will work closely with a Senior Brand Manager where they will help develop and execute strategies and annual plans that connect with consumers and generate long term profitable growth for Frucor.§Where do you fit in?§Here at Frucor Suntory, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and like to have fun but we don’t shy away from a challenge, and neither should you. A lot of what we look for is how you would align with our values ‘Together’, ‘Go For It‘ and ‘Make a Difference’.§You will:§Need to complete a relevant tertiary qualification in 2020§Have achieved consistently strong grades – we want to see the results from your dedication and commitment§Be a dynamic person who is passionate about marketing, thinks outside the box and thrives at being a part of an innovative and energetic environment§Have tonnes of initiative and won’t be afraid to get stuck in and give things a go with a passion for trailblazing ideas while being a part of exciting new solutions§Want to go places, so your ability to lead and influence people will be important§You would have proven you can achieve at uni now come and prove yourself as part of the Frucor team!§What can we do for you?§We offer a competitive base salary, a day off on your birthday, flexible working hours, study leave and the opportunity to earn an incentive. Working at Frucor Suntory isn't a job, it's a career. We support our people to be their best, and our learning and development opportunities are hard to beat. We share ideas, knowledge and expertise wherever we can to ensure our employees can flourish.§This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a great team and use their skills to influence our staff and customers. You will receive a high level of support to learn new skills and enhance your personal development.§How do I apply?§If you’re passionate about your career and seek a high growth environment, a strong team culture, career advancement and the opportunity to make a real difference to the company’s on-going success, then this is the role for you!§Please apply by submitting your CV and cover letter no later than §end of day Sunday 25 October§. Make sure to include in your application how you’re hungry to make drinks better with us!§Attention Recruitment Agencies: §Frucor Suntory has a Direct Sourcing model and at this point in time we will not require any recruitment agency support for this role.§§§§

unique role where you will work on global and local brands and leverage global resources and learnings.  You’ll be treated as an owner from day one, working closely with cross-functional teams to Outperform our expectations and you’ll move forward faster than you ever thought possible. Come ready to dream. Come eager to grow.§ § § §If you think you are up for the challenge that this role offers, then don’t hesitate to apply NOW!§ §Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand or who are certain they can gain eligibility through immigration processes should apply. jobTitle: Brand Partnership Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670083.txt	§Brand Partnership Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Partnership Manager§§Advertiser: §LES MILLS INTERNATIONAL LTD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§Purpose and passion: it’s a potent combination that drives us to achieve true greatness. At Les Mills International, unlocking and amplifying that inner drive to achieve goals is something we’re not shy to say we’re great at. We do it for millions of people around the globe each week by delivering life-changing fitness experiences. And we do it every day for our own team by providing a mandate to thrive, to play to strengths and to be proud of the part we play in creating a fitter planet.§LES MILLS™ On Demand is changing the game when it comes to working out at home. With a true start-up spirit driving the team to success, we’re putting 1000+ workouts at our customers’ fingertips – on their devices in the comfort of their own homes. We’ve a bold vision and big plans for this innovative offering, so come and jump in on the action.§We have a fantastic fixed term opportunity for a high-performing Brand Partnerships Manager within the D2C Marketing team. You’ll be tasked with raising brand awareness and consideration through direct-to-consumer strategic partnerships and other activations. This includes Influencer Marketing, Affiliate Marketing, cultivating agency relationships and innovative marketing and distribution partnerships.§Reporting to the Global Marketing Director D2C, you’ll play a critical role in the D2C team, utilizing your strength in relationship management to develop global commercial partnerships, and ideally you’ll have experience across the following areas;§ § §Building upon key agency relationships to reach new audiences and generate incremental subscriber growth§ §Identifying and nurturing new global partnerships to drive awareness, consideration and distribution for LES MILLS on Demand, ensuring these are launched and managed effectively§ §Extensive experience in delivering effective, outcome-focused end-to-end campaigns and journeys integrated with broader high season retail activity§ §Familiarity with TV and audio ad media buying (including programmatic), reporting and attribution§ §It’s an exciting time for us right now as we surge towards some steep growth goals and industry-leading innovations. We are an organization committed to providing a flexible, diverse and inclusive environment. In return for all you bring to us, we’ll return serve by giving you every chance to exercise your passion, and thrive with a company that’s out to change the world.§§§§

       §Project management skills, and an interest in further development of these skills by leading projects under supervision.§          §Technical ability in relevant digital applications.§        §        §How to Apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§        §Please click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§        §Applications close 16 October 2020.§      §    §    §      §      §    §  §§§About us | Mō mātou§The Ministry of Housing and This will include advising on appropriate channels for targeted delivery of communications and supporting team reporting and analysis tools, such as a weekly issues report and media monitoring.§Although you'll typically work alongside senior members of the team, the Ministry has a busy and diverse work programme with lots of potential to grow your skills and make your mark.§About you | Mōu§You will be a strong generalist, with up to five years' experience working in either a central government, community or Māori organisation environment. You'll help us produce effective communications and advise on the appropriate use of visual and social media channels to target our diverse audiences and create maximum impact.§Being innately curious and a self-starter, you'll be keen to deepen your exposure to a broad work programme and to build on your existing communication and project skills.§A natural connector and collaborator, you will be comfortable working at all levels and helping people across HUD with their engagement and communications needs.§With a keen risk radar, you will help identify issues that present risks or opportunities and provide mitigation options where appropriate, taking into account the broad programmes of work and the environment in which the Ministry operates.§What you'll bring to the role:§§Demonstrated experience in developing communications plans and content.§Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills across a variety of mediums and channels, including social media.§Proven ability to grasp complex concepts quickly and translate into engagement and communications activities.§Experience, or interest in acquiring experience, in stakeholder engagement.§Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular.§Project management skills, and an interest in further development of these skills by leading projects under supervision.§Technical ability in relevant digital applications.§§How to Apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§Applications close 16 October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing and Communications Specialist - 10 month fixed term Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670250.txt	§Marketing and Communications Specialist - 10 month fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Communications Specialist - 10 month fixed term§§Advertiser: §Southern Cross Hospitals§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Auckland CBD§ §For thousands of Kiwis, Southern Cross Hospitals is their favourite hospital. Our team is made up of 1,000 skilled and enthusiastic people. Our hospital teams enjoy working in world class facilities and with leading technology. Each year we have approximately 86,000 patients across our wholly owned and joint venture facilities, for surgical procedures. We lead our sector in quality, safety and overall patient experience. Our people embrace our values – Responsibility, Respect, Teamwork and Aspiration.§ §Apart from our hospitals, we have joint venture businesses with a number of surgical, endoscopy, physiotherapy, rehabilitation and corporate wellness companies.  This is an exciting time for us as we bring this network closer together. As a result, we have a fantastic, new opportunity at our National Office for an experienced marketing professional to join us as our §Marketing Communications Specialist§, in the heart of Auckland’s CBD.§ §About the role:§ §As the Marketing and Communications Specialist you will be required to provide integral hands on marketing and communication support to the business through an exciting period of change. §This is a 10-month full time, fixed term position working either four or five days per week. We are open to negotiation. You will however be required to work within core business hours.§ §You will be required to;§ § §Support the effective roll out of a new brand position and identity for the organisation§ §Support the day to day management and implementation of the marketing communications programme; aligned to the new brand story and identity§ §Provide practical brand, marketing and communications support to managers and teams within National Office, the business and partner networks§ §Develop communications to engage employees and other key stakeholders§ §Be a brand champion, educating and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure marketing and communications are in line with brand/business key messages and positioning§ §Support the evolution and use of web-based media (including the intranet and website), particularly in content development§ §Identify opportunities and make recommendations to add value to the brand and marketing effort§. § §To be successful you ideally will:§ § §Have a minimum of 5 years in a generalist brand and marketing role with services context§ §Have a Marketing or business qualification(s) -§ essential§ §Have a practical understanding of the ‘full marketing mix’ and integrated approach§ §Be a brand champion, with the ability to bring brand DNA to life through everyday activities of an organisation§ §Be a  confident and concise writer, able to write for varying audiences§ §Be experienced in marketing agency briefing and coordination§ §Have previous project budget and cost monitoring experience§ §You will be a motivated, collaborative team player with the ability to bring others on the journey. You will have advanced interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal), are highly organised, and can prioritise to deliver to timeframes. Importantly, you will be able to hit the ground running with a positive “can do” attitude.§ §Apply now to join one of New Zealand’s most trusted brands at an exciting time in our journey.§§§§

The ideal person for this role will have a tertiary qualification in marketing or communications and some exposure to marketing, ideally in a professional environment (around 6-18 months).§This role is integral to the success of the Business Development & Marketing team - providing specialist marketing support to internal and external audiences, with a focus on external marketing communications channels and events. The role assists in planning, delivering and tracking engaging marketing and communication activities that support our firm's vision of being the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people.§You will use your proven oral and written communication skills to assist with internal and external communications. You will have strong IT skills and affinity for new technology and social media, as you will be working with a variety of digital platforms to gain insight and deliver targeted communications.§You will work closely with legal teams to deliver excellent thought leadership events and support business development pursuits including pitch development.§The successful candidate will demonstrate initiative and drive, and a proven ability to achieve objectives by working to a plan. An ability to juggle multiple responsibilities at once, responding with flexibility and an enthusiastic 'can do' attitude is essential. We are seeking a pro-active team player - someone who thrives off delivering to an exceptional standard.§The delivery of high quality events means irregular hours may be required from time to time.§If you have the following skills and experience, please get in touch:§Tertiary qualification (preferably in marketing or communications)§Excellent attention to detail - proven experience writing excellent communications§Collaborative team player is a must§Social media skills and digital campaigns experience, including analytical evaluation skills§Eagerness to learn and support the wider team§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§For more detailed information, please see the link to the position description at the bottom of this page.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart.§We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific region.§How to apply§Please click 'Apply' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kiri Sullivan, Senior HR Advisor on +64 353 9991.§Only those legally entitled to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. All applications treated in confidence.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50670400.txt	§Digital Inclusion Programmes Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Inclusion Programmes Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §Central & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Inclusion Programmes Co-ordinator §      §        §The Digital Inclusion Programmes Co-ordinator will promote and Hawke’s Bay community.§        §You will have 3-4 years of demonstrated experience in a related business, community, education or tourism industry, and will be able to demonstrate how your knowledge and expertise has made a tangible difference in the communities and environments you have worked in.  §        §This is a very exciting and unique opportunity for the right person to gain a step-up or to use your experience and knowledge to make a tangible difference for our community. §        §If this sounds like you, please apply in confidence with a cover letter and CV.§        §Applications close 16 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Digital Inclusion Programmes Co-ordinator will promote and support social and economic inclusion by building future resilience and promoting community wellbeing within the Central Hawke’s Bay community, through the development and coordination of programmes that are focused on the many aspects of digital literacy.  It will include skill building and social interaction through digital programmes and events to bridge the digital divide and increase digital literacy of the community for all ages.§  §This role will also include upskilling library staff in the digital area to enable all staff to contribute to the goals above.§  §Our experience through Covid-19 has shown how critical it is for people to be connected and able to be active participants in the digital world.§  §To be successful in this role while being a jack-of-all-trades, you will have strong technology and writing skills in the widest sense, be able to confidently relate to people of all ages and cultures and be used to balancing different priorities in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Importantly, you will have a sound understanding of the important role of libraries, in supporting the social and economic wellbeing of the Central Hawke’s Bay community.§  §You will have 3-4 years of demonstrated experience in a related business, community, education or tourism industry, and will be able to demonstrate how your knowledge and expertise has made a tangible difference in the communities and environments you have worked in.  §  §This is a very exciting and unique opportunity for the right person to gain a step-up or to use your experience and knowledge to make a tangible difference for our community. §  §If this sounds like you, please apply in confidence with a cover letter and CV.§  §Applications close 16 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50670410.txt	§Senior Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Infinitas Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Direct Marketing & CRM§§§§§§We have a unique 6 month contract opportunity with one of New Zealand’s leading global technology companies to join their marketing department as a Senior Marketing Specialist. This role will specialise in the marketing of technical products globally. The company has a fantastic culture and work hard to develop and accommodate their staff to encourage a productive and progressive working environment.§  § We are looking for someone experienced in B2B marketing who is motivated to create and build strong relationships with stakeholders.§  § We are searching for somebody who can take on the project of working alongside an agency to redevelop the website, as well as effectively integrating a new CRM system, allowing for effective client interaction and launching the company into their next phase of marketing. This role will then require a digital marketing strategy to be developed and rolled out.§  § You will have a technical and strategic mind but won’t balk at rolling up your sleeves and working operationally to implement and see strategies completed end-to-end. You will understand working to a budget and thinking outside the box to work around any perceived limitations.§A good command of language and creative content would be desirable, as the organization aims to strengthen investor relations and marketing communications.§  § We are searching for someone who is working at the top of their game, who will bring enthusiasm and a good energy to the workplace, and who can navigate positive internal relationships. There is opportunity to coach and mentor others through projects and skills, and someone who has the capability to lead well will be favourable in a role such as this.§ § As this is a global company, global experience is preferred but not crucial.§  § Onsite parking available.§  § Roles like this are extremely rare so please apply to the role online as soon as possible or if you have any questions please call Sophie on §09 218 4836§ §  § For more information about Infinitas Talent please follow this link http://infinitas-talent.co.nz  §  § You must be a NZ / Australian citizen or have a valid New Zealand work visa to be able to apply for this position.§§§§

jobTitle: Content Creator & Digital Marketing Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670516.txt	§Content Creator & Digital Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Creator & Digital Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Linden Leaves§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Do you live and breathe digital and love telling stories?§  §Are you a highly articulate go-getter with a winning combination of impeccable organisational skills and a strong flair for visual storytelling?§  § §  §Linden Leaves is a New Zealand owned and operated beauty business focused on delighting our customers across New Zealand and around the globe.§  § §  §We are looking for someone with a genuine passion for natural beauty who is completely at home in the digital world to join us on a contract basis as a Content Creator and Digital Marketing Coordinator.§  § §  §This newly established contract role will report to our Creative Director and work alongside our small, results-driven Auckland based marketing, design and digital team. This part time contract role has scope to evolve into a permanent role when the results speak for themselves.§  § §  §The role will support our brand position as a global leader by delivering strategic, engaging digital campaigns and tactical responses that create a sense of brand community and build brand loyalty.§  §A solid grasp of general marketing concepts and the ability to understand and deliver communications in the appropriate brand tone is required.§  §You will drive value through helping us succeed in the fast-moving digital space.§  § §  §Key tasks include:§ § §Content creation – photography & video / animations§ §Effective digital marketing execution: drive effective execution of the digital marketing calendar on a quarterly, monthly and weekly basis; take a lead role in digital communication and marketing§ §Assist in delivering the direct email program§ §Assist in building relationships with online influencers including bloggers, video bloggers and online publishers§ §Assist with existing e-tailer relationships and content requirements, including promotions, exclusives and brand positioning and art & video requirements§ §Lead activities and provide day-to-day support to increase engagement and growth of all social media platforms§ §Deliver visual assets, copy, samples to e-tailers.§ § §  §Other examples of day to day tasks are: assisting with the social calendar & strategy, digital ad creation, managing and amplifying product review content, creating product demonstration videos, photoshoots, arranging competitions, blog posts, supporting small events such as product launches, engaging with other social media communities and bloggers, building the image libraries on social platforms, responding to enquiries and social media posts…§  §This multifaceted role will require someone with§ § §a results-driven approach and experience with digital marketing including mail software, facebook & instagram ads and google ads§ §social media experience across all core platforms at a brand level§ §communication, results analysis and reporting skills - proven understanding of web & social platform metrics with the ability to track and generate reports§ §experience with social media management software§ §digital design experience and a strong aesthetic sense§ §photography, video & editing skills§ §excellent copywriting and marketing communications§ §a sound understanding of brand, tone and visual communication§ §great interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate closely with creatives§ §excellent organisation and time management with the ability to take initiative, demonstrate leadership and work independently§ §flexibility and the ability to take on new challenges as an early adopter§ §a proven ability to problem solve and take on a multitude of tasks with a “can-do” attitude§ §a consistently efficient and responsible manner§ §accuracy in completion of tasks to deadline§ §a hunger to learn and develop new skills§ § §  §We are not a big corporate. We are a fast paced, nimble business with a small team atmosphere. We have limited resources to achieve big goals and take pride in delivering world class results with the resources available.§  § §  §Our team go above and beyond on a daily basis because they believe in our mission - to offer sustainably and ethically produced natural wellbeing and skincare products that allow women to feel great every day.§  § §  §Our people can think big and work hard - and are happy to find innovative solutions and get hands-on to make it happen.§  § §  §The recruitment of this position is being managed by Juliet Blair. Please send your cv and cover letter to §juliet@lindenleaves.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670609.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Wilderness Motorhomes / SmartRV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§About us§Here at Wilderness Motorhomes and SmartRV, we are passionate about delivering dream rental and retail ownership experiences for our guests and customers. To achieve this we rent and sell premium products and provide superior support and service. With international travel not an option at the moment, the demand for domestic tourism is high, and what better way to see our beautiful country than in a luxury motorhome that takes you places you’ve never been before. §About you§You are a self-proclaimed wordsmith! Your love of writing content shines through in any masterpiece you create. Being highly detail focussed, any piece of work must get your tick of approval before it goes public. You thrive on being process-oriented and are experienced in using content management among many other technology systems. Your independent and proactive approach sees you be able to effectively organise and prioritse your day no matter what comes along. Along with all of these personal attributes you will have a business or marketing qualification and at least 3-5 years of marketing and content creation experience.  §What you’ll be doing§Working across both of our brands, your core responsibilities will be focussed around writing captivating content along with editing and proofreading. You will take ownership of our digital assets through managing images, flyers, and reviews ensuring our brand messaging converts customers into brand advocates. You’ll be immersed in our technology systems, uploading to our CMS, ensuring our websites are always kept up to date and on-brand. You'll enjoy being on a continuous improvement journey with our processes as well as exploring new ways of engaging current and potential customers. §How to Apply§If you think this sounds like your dream opportunity, we'd love to hear from you so please apply Now! This is your chance to demonstrate your creative flair by showcasing this in your CV and cover letter. It would also be great to include some samples of your writing to really showcase your writing talent!§Application Process & Updates§Part of the application process includes completing a job specific application form. Depending on the job board and device you apply with, you'll either see the form on the next screen or it will be emailed to you immediately, upon receiving your application. §Please check your inbox (and junk mail) for application updates. Emails are sent via our recruitment software, Chilli Factor. §If this sounds like you and you're ready for your next adventure with a dynamic NZ tourism company, please apply today!§§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing & Branding Creative  Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50671020.txt	§Marketing & Branding Creative §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing & Branding Creative §§Advertiser: §pdc creative§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§A fantastic opportunity has arisen for a marketing and branding star to join our creative team. §Due to a growing client base, we are looking for a creative individual that can bring new ideas, energy and loads of fun to our small but mighty team. §You will get to work with some amazing clients, from a mix of industries, to assist with their branding and marketing requirements. You will love working on a range of projects with varied tasks, such as helping with naming and tagline creation, contributing to developing a site map for a website, providing creative direction, coming up with ideas to help a client with a campaign, and so much more.§You must have at least 3 years, full-time experience working in the marketing and branding industry and/or the relevant tertiary education. You will also have a good understanding and experience in digital marketing and also ideally a firm grasp on brand strategy. Design fundamentals such as typography, composition and a sound understanding of visual communication are all things that get your types spinning. §You will be very passionate about building strong client relationships, have a can-do attitude and be able to work autonomously and be totally self-directed.   § §In a perfect world the ideal candidate would have experience in some or all of the following: §Assisting clients with brand strategy which includes establishing positioning, messaging, personality, tone and being the creative lead for developing visual identity systems.§Developing short and long term marketing plans§Providing clients with marketing and branding advice and guidance§Coming up with ideas for campaigns §Roll out of new and rebrand campaign across multiple platforms§Providing creative direction to the design team§Graphic design and a sound understanding of visual communication §Experience in content development, website design and management §An understanding of SEO and analytics tools§Working closely with external  marketing resources such as copywriters, videographers and photographers § §About pdc creative§We are a team of creative specialists who provide marketing and branding strategy, stunning graphic design, print and web services. We shape and position brands and their offerings, so that they are engaging, distinctive and memorable in the minds of consumers, to enable growth. In short, we ensure brands appeal to target markets across digital, print and physical touchpoints. §We are passionate about a working environment that is fun and supportive and believe that our culture is one of the most important things.§ If you tend to be a grumpy grump, have mood swings, are snappy, sulky, or negative, like to complain or spit the dummy, then this is not the position for you.§It’s possible this position could be adapted to suit someone full time, part-time or fixed-term, depending on what would work best for both parties.§ §§§§
