jobTitle: Advisor, Brand and Channel Management Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50688519.txt	§Advisor, Brand and Channel Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor, Brand and Channel Management§§Advertiser: §SOLGM§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§We are looking for a creative and solutions-focused Advisor to join our small Wellington-based team. Due to our expanding work programmes we are reshaping our organisation which includes the creation of this new role.§  §If you would you like to work for an organisation that prides itself on being relevant and responsive, then this role could be for you.§  §Who are we?§  §SOLGM is the national membership organisation for local government professionals. Our purpose is to promote and support professional management in local government.§  §We provide professional leadership, promote innovation and excellence in management practice, and develop local government capability to enhance service delivery to our local communities, throughout NZ§  §We are small team, but we punch well above our weight!§  §www.solgm.org.nz§  §What is the role?§  §As our Advisor, Brand and Channel Management you will be part of a small communications team focused on positioning SOLGM as a knowledgeable thought-leader in the local government sector. This role will involve a mix of website administration, brand management and content delivery, providing you with variety and challenge.§  §You will be responsible for ensuring that our websites are maintained and that our brand is applied consistently across our communication channels, products and other activities. You will be instrumental in distributing the content developed by your colleagues and take pride in delivering a professional look, feel and structure. This could include e-newsletters, social media, reports, programmes and products as well as contributing to the look and feel of our online and face-to-face events.§  §It is an exciting time for SOLGM as we explore options for the future and this is a great opportunity to apply your creative eye, website and design skills as part of this.§  §About you§You will:§ § §have well-developed website and design skills § §have demonstrated experience of web best-practice and functionality§ §have a good knowledge of design principles and brand application across digital and print communications§ §have excellent attention to detail§ §have the ability to show initiative§ §be flexible in your approach to your work with a ‘can-do’ attitude.§ §This role is a great opportunity for someone looking to further their website and brand skills within a communications team in an established organisation.§  §How to apply§  §If you are interested in working for us, we encourage you to apply below.  Please submit your CV, along with a short cover letter telling us why you would love to work with us, and how your skills, knowledge and experience fit the role. §  §For any enquiries, or any questions about either role please email vacancy@solgm.org.nz §  §Applications close Sunday 18th October 2020.§  §Please note that eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory, and due to current boarder conditions, we will not be accepting overseas applicants at this time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing & Social Media Co-Ordinator Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50688738.txt	§Marketing & Social Media Co-Ordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing & Social Media Co-Ordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§About the company§  §The business is a well-established manufacturer and supplier to New Zealand’s leading Food Retailers and Foodservice sectors of high-quality products that are produced under best practice production conditions from our well-established facility in Tauranga.  Our products are distributed to markets throughout New Zealand and into export markets via a network of specialist distributors.§  §With the business performing strongly, we are looking to lift overall marketing activity to further capitalise on opportunities to grow our brand profiles and overall marketing communications within existing and new markets that we wish to enter.§  §To support this need it has been decided to increase our marketing presence and therefore there is an opportunity to introduce a new role, that of a Marketing and Social Media Co-Ordinator to take the business to a new level of market and customer expansion across a number of market segments where our products are sold with a particular emphasis of growing our social media presence, brand profiles and consumer-driven promotional activity.§  §This role provides the rare opportunity to combine your marketing, communications, digital and design skills and experiences.§  §Working closely with our Sales team, the successful applicant will be able to confidently multi-task across marketing, graphic design, event co-ordination and customer support.§  §Your ability to prioritise effectively while providing great communication and being able to efficiently co-ordinate activities across the business will be essential.§  §About the role§  §As Marketing and Social Media Co-Ordinator, you will be responsible for:§ § §Creating content including graphic design, copywriting, video and other visual marketing material for Website, EDM and promotional print collateral§ §Manage all communications to our current and potential customers§ §Assist with planning, creating and scheduling digital marketing and social media content and activity§ §Produce the brand-compliant locally appealing graphic design of product artwork, catalogues and campaign collateral§ §Maximising our CRM and Database information, help convert sales leads with existing and prospective customers and clients§ §Creating engaging content for the company’s social media presence, including keeping social media channels updated on brand. Additionally, you will have the initiative and insights to seek out new social media avenues and other ways of connecting with our customers and clients§ §Other tasks associated within the sales and marketing department§ §Skills and experience§  §We are keen to talk to experienced Marketing professionals with the following key attributes: § § §3 years or more experience working in a similar role§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Experience in using digital marketing technology, including WordPress, Facebook and Shopify§ §Proficient in MS Office§ §Creative design skills, graphics and image re-touching ability to produce high-quality artwork§ §Experience with Google AdWords, Analytics and SEO optimization§ §Possess a “Can-do” attitude and can work well under pressure to meet deadlines§ §Initiative to think across brands, to look at the big picture and offer input and ideas to the business§ §Can conceptualise and take to market promotional activity to support sales growth§ §Can demonstrate experience in developing brand strategy and market activation§ §Analytical thinker who is competent with analysing data in the decision-making process§ §Demonstrate a high level of work productivity, exhibited self-starter, a commitment to reduce unproductive time, taking the initiative and a display of leadership in getting on with the job§ §Formal qualification would be preferred.§ §Benefits§  §A very competitive salary is on offer for this role. The Business is also committed to the continual development of the markets in which we operate across both locally and internationally; therefore, there will be plenty of training and exciting opportunities to influence the future direction of our business.§  §How to Apply§  §If you believe you have the skills and attitude for this newly created role and are looking for your next career challenge, we would like to hear from you. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years of graphic design experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692453.txt	§Digital Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About us§ At Life Flight, every moment counts when the emergency phone rings. Each call-out is different and important; it may be to help a car accident victim, to rescue a diver, or to fly a premature baby to urgent medical care.§   § It takes a team to make emergency flights possible 24/7. Everyone working for Life Flight plays a part in achieving our overall mission: To save lives. Life Flight is a charity that holds a special place in the hearts and minds of the community.§   § §About the role§ We’re looking for an exceptional Digital Marketing Manager to lead our digital marketing activity.§   § You will be joining a friendly, supportive, close-knit team who enjoy getting together for the morning quiz and sharing the occasional batch of baking. Much of the groundwork on our digital strategy has been done; we’re now looking for someone to bring their creative flair to take this to the next level.§   § Your success will be defined by the number of digital interactions that progress through to donations, the increased loyalty and satisfaction of supporters, the quality of your analysis and the increase in positive brand recognition. Up for the challenge?§   § You’ll be responsible for:§ § §The day-to-day management of Life Flight’s digital promotional activity (including web-based promotions and social media campaigns)§ §The development of Life Flight’s Digital Strategy§ §Contributing regular analysis and insight reports across key digital platforms§ §Leading and mentoring the Marketing & Communications Coordinator§ §Leading the creative development of Life Flight’s online look and feel including campaign production and targeting§ §Liaising closely with our vendor partners and wider stakeholders community§ §   § §We’re looking for someone with:§ § §Three or more years’ experience in digital marketing (including website)§ §Experience interpreting analytics and the stories they tell§ §Significant exposure to multi-channel marketing campaigns§ §Top notch interpersonal skills and a well-honed service ethic§ §A desire to keep Life Flight at the forefront of industry trends and changes§ §Creativity§ §A relevant tertiary qualification§ §A current driver’s licence§ §Appreciation of the values of the not-for-profit sector§ § §To Apply§ If you’re looking for a role with real purpose and are keen to be part of a tight knit team, look no further. Please §apply now §with your CV and a cover letter letting us know a bit about you and what you’d bring to the role.  Applications close as soon as we find the right person – apply now, we’d love to hear from you!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Client Services Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692487.txt	§Client Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Services Manager§§Advertiser: §Aro Digital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Don’t miss the opportunity to join this locally owned and independent agency in the beating heart of Wellington§Be part of improving the quality & understanding of NZs digital marketing scene§Work with some of the most exciting businesses in NZ§Fun, collaborative team that look out for each other§About us§Aro is a digital marketing agency that’s all about growing awesome Kiwi ideas.§We work with a number of exciting businesses across New Zealand to help them achieve excellent results through an innovative digital approach. From local outfits like Silverstripe, Sustainability Trust, and Hurricanes Rugby right through to organisations such as Meridian Energy, Weta Workshop, homes.co.nz and more.§We’re a fun and diverse team who like to get out and about, hosting regular team activities and office field trips. Work life harmony is important to us, it's part of who we are.§Why Aro?§Our offices are based§ §in Oriental Bay with stunning views of the Wellington harbour. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to help us shape and improve the quality of NZ’s digital marketing scene. You’ll start your morning with a coffee from Supreme (courtesy of our in-house coffee machine) or have the choice of popping downstairs to the iconic Wellington café, Beach Babylon.§Your goals and dreams are important to us – so your career progression is always front of mind. We’re growing rapidly which enables us to provide employees with new opportunities that broaden their experience.§We love the feel-good stuff – like supporting local purpose driven businesses with our services in what we call, the ‘Impact Hour’.§What we’re searching for§A devoted Client Success Manager to help take our business to the next level. Leading the communication with our clients, nurturing, retaining and developing existing relationships will be just some of the things you thrive on.§You will bring at least 3-5 years’ experience in client services or digital marketing with proven experience retaining and growing existing client relationships. Alongside experience overseeing high performing specialist teams to ensure a cohesive delivery of world class digital campaigns.§Your top-notch project management & communication skills and exceptional stakeholder management will not go unnoticed here. Nor will your creative approach and ability to think outside the box when looking to improve upon existing digital campaigns.§The icing on the cake would be that you have some experience or knowledge using platforms such as Google Marketing Platform (Campaign Manager, DV360, SA360), Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Programmatic, Google Analytics, & Other ad serving / optimisation tools would be ideal.§A typical day in the life of you§You’ll be working directly with our clients to help shape digital strategies and educate them on best practice recommendations§Setting and exceeding client objectives & KPIs§Help develop Aro Digital best practice in client relationship management and assist in communications across an array of key clients§Manage the onboarding process and complete contract or project sign off§Maintain existing client relationships with integrity and a focus on Aro’s core values§Lead process development and implementation/execution of client development plans for Key Clients§Manage internal resources to insure completion of all digital marketing activity§Strategic planning and execution of digital marketing campaigns that are truly aligned with clients’ business objectives and Aro’s core values§Work with specialists to execute on all digital marketing campaigns when required§Have a dedicated focus on process and technological improvements that will speed up the delivery of work whilst maintaining or increasing quality.§Bring it on! How do I apply?§Whether this is all stuff you’ve done before, or you know that you are capable of doing, we want to hear from you! We will consider candidates with a range of experience and backgrounds to make sure we find the right fit.§So, if you think you have what it takes then apply now! We love a good cover letter telling us why you feel you're the ‘the one’ so go on, show us what you can bring. We are looking forward to hearing from you.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a client services manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Search Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692490.txt	§Senior Search Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Search Specialist§§Advertiser: §Aro Digital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Don’t miss the opportunity to join this locally owned and independent agency in the beating heart of Wellington§ § §Be part of improving the quality & understanding of NZs digital marketing scene and join one of the fastest growing agencies§ §Work with some of the most exciting businesses in NZ§ §Fun, collaborative team that look out for each other§ §Lots of team events and collaboration, solving some of the biggest digital challenges§ §The best office in Wellington (we think at least) with tonnes of outdoor and sports gear, coffee, food and drinks§ § §  §About us§  §Aro is a digital marketing agency that’s all about growing awesome Kiwi ideas.§  §We work with a number of exciting businesses across New Zealand to help them achieve excellent results through an innovative digital approach. From local outfits like Silverstripe, Sustainability Trust, and Hurricanes Rugby right through to organisations such as Meridian Energy, Weta Workshop, homes.co.nz, World of Wearable Arts, Plunket and more.§  §We’re a fun and diverse team who like to get out and about, hosting regular team activities and office field trips. Work life harmony is important to us, it's part of who we are.§  § §  §Why Aro?§  §Our offices are based in Oriental Bay with stunning views of the Wellington harbour. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to help us shape and improve the quality of NZ’s digital marketing scene. You’ll start your morning with a coffee from Supreme (courtesy of our in-house coffee machine) or have the choice of popping downstairs to the iconic Wellington café, Beach Babylon.§  §Your goals and dreams are important to us – so your career progression is always front of mind. We’re growing rapidly which enables us to provide employees with new opportunities that broaden their experience.§  §We love the feel-good stuff – like supporting local purpose driven businesses with our services in what we call, the ‘Impact Hour’.§  § §  §What we’re searching for§  §As a senior member of the Performance team, you’ll help plan, deliver and report on digital marketing campaigns through Google Ads, Facebook, Google Marketing Platform (e.g. DV360) and more. You will bring at least 3-5 years’ experience in paid search and analytics with proven experience in launching, managing and optimising digital campaigns, as well as tracking, tagging and insights analysis.§  §A typical day in the life of you§ § §Nurture junior team members and provide guidance and leadership around all things ppc, analytics, and data§ §Continue to refine our performance offerings (paid media, SEO, analytics, marketing automation) and build up our capabilities and internal skill sets§ §Manage some of the coolest clients paid media and analytics activity§ §Manage internal resources to insure completion of all digital marketing activity§ §Campaign Execution§ § §Creating and managing paid search, social and other digital campaigns§ §Keep up to date with the latest updates and improvements within the SEM / Social / digital space – identify trends, new approaches and technologies§ §Work directly in Google Marketing Platform, Google Ads, Bing, Facebook and YouTube technologies to launch campaigns§ §Building and analysing paid media & website data and provide insights into performance§ §Direct responsibility & ownership across client accounts including strategic approach, bid recommendations and performance§ §Ensure that billing, invoicing, budget management are being managed and inputted into tracking tools§ §Campaign Strategy§ § §Creation and strategic planning of digital marketing campaigns that are truly aligned with clients’ business objectives§ §Planning, developing and organising campaigns and strategies to support sales objectives§ §Work with other performance and creative specialists to execute on all digital marketing campaigns when required§ §Look for constant process and technological improvements that will speed up the delivery of work whilst maintaining, or, increasing quality§ §Bring it on! How do I apply?§  §Whether this is all stuff you’ve done before, or you know that you are capable of doing, we want to hear from you! We will consider candidates with a range of experience and backgrounds to make sure we find the right fit.§  §So, if you think you have what it takes then apply now! We love a good cover letter telling us why you feel you're the ‘the one’ so go on, show us what you can bring. We are looking forward to hearing from you.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Content Writer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692878.txt	§Content Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Writer§§Advertiser: §Coretex§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§At Coretex we believe that technology should be used to build a safer, greener and more productive society. The world’s resources are under increasing pressure - to keep growing, we have got to figure out how to do more with less. Our proprietary technology platform helps organisations run more efficiently and align with complex legislation through intelligent use of data gathered directly from fleet assets.§Coretex has customers all over the globe. Our business is run from offices in New York, San Diego, Auckland, and Sydney. We have ambitious growth plans that will see us further expand operations over the coming weeks, months and years. Help us build that reality.§  §The opportunity:§  §We’re a technology company with some fairly complex solutions, and need a strong copywriter who can take internal tech-speak and spin it into an engaging and jargon-free read.§As part of a distributed global marketing team you will be based in the Auckland HQ to be close to both the product and executive teams - where the magic happens, as they say!§  §You’ll be responsible for all forms of content writing and be as comfortable writing a punchy ad or social post as you are researching for long form pieces like industry reports. With the majority of content being digital, we’re looking for someone with experience in all the usual areas of automation journeys, blogging, social, and emails as well as the less measurable (but often more fun!) print pieces like catchy invites and leave-behinds.§  §We’re embarking on some ambitious projects at both a brand and campaign level, so you can expect to be part of a wide range of work alongside our Creative Director and Marketing Lead. §  §About you:§  §In addition to your superior writing skills, you’ll need to be an advocate for the customer and write for them, not just for SEO (obviously we care about SEO and all the other measurable acronyms, but it’s customer first, then the rest).§  §Ideally you’ll have some form of background in tech, and have worked inside a demand-gen centred marketing team. Bonus points if you’ve got ABM experience!§  §You’ll also be able to help us write way better job ads for our next marketing hire! §  §This is an outstanding opportunity to grow your career and make an impact that matters. Are you ready to help us build our new reality?§  §** Please include some writing samples as part of your application **§  §Coretex is an equal opportunities employer. We appreciate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.§§§§

A great creative eye and copywriting skills would be a huge bonus too.§ §You’ll need a tertiary qualification in Marketing or a related qualification PLUS a minimum 5 years’ experience in a brand marketing role.§ §In your application we want to hear about you - what makes you tick and why you think your next opportunity is here with us.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Communications Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695781.txt	§Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §people&co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Part-time role, in the for-purpose sector§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§ §Passionate storyteller required § §For a broad, diverse communications role within the for-purpose sector § §Permanent, part-time hours§ §Are you a passionate, creative storyteller?  A person who thrives in an environment where no two days are the same? You enjoy turning your hand to a range of communications task and now seek a role that motivates you to jump out of bed each day to make a difference? Then please read on.§ §In partnership with Victim Support, People&co are excited to present this newly created opportunity for a Communications Advisor to join their team.§As part of the Communications and Fundraising team this role will support the organisation to tell its stories effectively and expertly, creating greater connectivity and awareness amongst key audiences.§ §Aspects of the role will include: § § §Bringing content to life across a range of channels digital and non-digital § §Meeting and interviewing a range of people to support them to tell their stories § §Annual report preparation § §Social media management § §Communications database administration and management § §Collaborating with internal teams such as fundraising, volunteer recruitment and providing communications support as required § §Various communications project support § §The full position description can be viewed on our website.§ §The right person for this role will offer: § § §Storytelling, content creation prowess and passion § §Proven experience writing for a broad range of channels § §An up-to-date knowledge of social media. How to develop and manage effective messages in the online environment § §Excellent written and oral communication skills § §Strong people skills, with a proven ability to work and relate to a range of different people § §An ability to self-manage, prioritise your workflow to meet weekly deadlines in your hours § §An open, collaborative nature, with the confidence to contribute new ideas § §Confidence to share new ideas, with the resilience to accept feedback § §A preference for working in a small team environment § §In return this is an opportunity to become part of a positive, and supportive team environment, doing incredibly meaning work in the social impact sector. With some exciting new communications projects on the horizon, this is a prime time to join them on this journey.§ §This is a part-time position, 20-25 hours per week, in their Thorndon based offices.  § §Interested people should §APPLY NOW§ or contact §Katie Kemp§ on §(04) 931 9466§, quoting job number §19519§ to discuss this opportunity further. Applications will be reviewed on a daily basis and will close on §Monday, 19 October.§ All applications will be acknowledged electronically.§ §Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa visit www.immigration.govt.nz § §§§§

jobTitle: Talent Agent - Events Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696318.txt	§Talent Agent - Events§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Agent - Events§§Advertiser: §Johnson & Laird Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Event Management§§§§§§Talent Agent & Booker§ § § §Are you passionate about the Creative and Events Industries?§  § § §Do you have previous experience in business development within the industry?§  § § §Are you a team player with a focus on customer service?§  § §If so, this may be the role for you!  §  §Reporting to the Talent Agent Manager we are looking for an experienced sales professional to fufil the role of Talent Agent and hustler within our Events Division. As a highly performing agent and business development professional this role will be to actively sell and market Johnson & Laird's top New Zealand talent. §  §You will be expected to take ownership of the development of this division with the clear objective of growing and servicing existing clients as well as generating new opportunities. This is a busy role which may require some out of hours work from time to time.§  §You can expect to be well supported through training however, a solid level of knowledge about current New Zealand talent would be advantageous.§  §About us§  §Johnson & Laird are NZ's leading Talent agency, representing the country's best actors, MCs/entertainers/speakers/corporate/content creator and voice talent. We provide a proactive and creative approach to representing our talent, dedicated to finding the perfect match for clients to satisfy their needs.§  §The position§  §As a Talent Agent & hustler in our Events Division you will be responsible for the growth and development of relationships with talent, agencies, event companies and corporates. You will provide an exceptional level of customer service and support to all parties in order to ensure that all opportunities in the market are available for Johnson & Laird talent and are followed up and secured successfully for them where possible.§  §This is an opportunity for you to step up and truly make your mark in the creative industry and the events industry!§  §Key responsibilities:§ § §Full understanding and knowledge required of all talent, their specialities, full work history over all divisions§ §Proactively form new relationships, maintinaing a pipeline of sales opportunities§ §Provide quotes on request§ §Negotiation of from initial brief and /or enquiries through to quote & final contract§ §Responsible for all submissions/Bookings and all liaison with relevant parties§ §Regularly attend industry events to drive awareness of J&L and our talent§ §High level negotiation, contract and trouble shooting skills§ §Attend industry events to watch J&L talent showcase, to develop a futher understanding of their performance§ §To be part of our team you will have the:§ § § §Ability to work under pressure§  § § §High level negotiation, contract and trouble shooting skills.§  § § §To be a team player§  § § §A positive 'can do' attitude§  § § §Out of this world interpersonal skills§  § § §Experience with contracts and negotiations within the creative industry§  § § §Be results driven and client focused with demonstrated use of initiative and commercial nous§  § § §Ability to attend events outside of standard working hours§  § § §Xero experience would be advantageous §  § § §Most importantly you must have a highly developed interest in the creative and event industries§  § §Experience and education § § § §Passion for the creative arts and events industries§  § § §Previous administrative experience§  § § §Previous experience in the events industry would be advantageous§  § § §Photoshop experience§  § § §Computer skills including basic touch typing §  § § §Preferably a Bachelor of Communications Studies or similiar§  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Specialist- Customer Communications (Fixed Term- 6 Months) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696452.txt	§Specialist- Customer Communications (Fixed Term- 6 Months)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist- Customer Communications (Fixed Term- 6 Months)§§Advertiser: §SKY TV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Competitive Salary, Flexible Working§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§About the role…§ §As the Specialist – Customer Communications you’ll be part of our newly created project squad, working alongside our Customer Engagement team with a combined purpose to deliver sustainable value for our customers and shareholders.§ §As part of the project squad, you’ll be on a fixed term contract with an immediate start through to April 2021 and will collaborate with the Project Lead to manage and execute seven service projects during this period.§ §You’ll be responsible for the creative design, execution and delivery of service communications to existing customers and those on-boarding from other channels. Communications will have a strong customer lens with an emphasis on change and will include Email, Direct Mail, SMS and more.§ §The key areas of focus will include;§ § §Copywriting and creation of customer service messages for the product§ §Build of direct to customer comms including, but not limited to, creative ideation, imagery selection, copy, etc§ §Translating complex service messages into engaging and simple to understand communications with our customers§ §Ensuring all customer communications meet legal and regulatory requirements§ §Working with cross-functional teams to design how all direct comms and correct information will be delivered to the customers§ §What Skills and Experience you’ll need…§ § §Minimum of 4 years’ direct to customer marketing§ §Customer centric – ensure that the customer is placed at the heart of every decision and are a disciple of leveraging insights to growth§ §Proven written and verbal communication skills § §Proven creative judgement and passion for the art of storytelling  § §Ability to influence others to agree with and support one’s agenda§ §The Cherry on the top…§ § §An excellent salary package§ §Flexible Working including working from home§ §Discounted Gym Membership at the YMCA§ §Free parking onsite§ §A Bit About Us…§ §We’re Sky, an entertainment company that has been connecting New Zealanders to the stories and sport they love for nearly 30 years. We’re proud of what we’ve achieved and are excited about where we’re heading. We’re redefining our boundaries and challenging ourselves to do better. We’re moving fast, listening to our customers, creating solutions and taking calculated risks.   § §How to Apply§ §Please send your CV and Cover letter to §jobs@sky.co.nz§.  A full role profile can be provided upon request§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50697049.txt	§Media and Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media and Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §JASMAX§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Jasmax is a multi-disciplinary design studio, New Zealand owned and operated, with a focus on sustainability and biculturalism. We are a community of architects, landscape architects, urban designers, interior designers and brand designers who are responsible for some the country's most iconic and sustainable architecture. We have collaborated on projects such as CRL, B:Hive, Fonterra's Head Office, AUT Sir Paul Reeves building, The Cloud, Shed 10 and more.§We have an opportunity for an experienced Marketing Communications Advisor to join our Marketing and Business Development team, on a 12 month fixed term contract. You will raise the Jasmax profile through content production and publishing, while maintaining the standards and media relationships held. §This varied role will be involved in the full media and awards strategy, with a focus on submitting projects to design awards, managing our social media presence and promoting the Jasmax brand. This will include:§Own the external communications and social media strategy, leading from the front. §Create award submissions, manage and track the success rates and analytics. §Develop, lead and execute the annual content plan and media strategy.  §Monitor key project milestones and produce content to socialise key project milestones and achievements.§Liaise with media and handle requests for interviews, statements etc. and foster relationships with advocates§§Requirements§You will have a minimum of 4 years' relevant experience in a marketing communications/public relations role, ideally in professional services or a similar industry. This position relies on your relationship building and communication skills, which you have a solid foundation in, as seen in your portfolio. You are the medium between our senior management team, media stakeholders and external customers, and are known to translate technical and industry terminology into a succinct and compelling tale. §§Benefits§You will a join a tight-knit team with flexibility in working times and hours. We would consider reduced hours for the right person although this would ideally still be across Monday to Friday. We will provide you with a laptop so you can work from home as needed, and encourage you to develop and make the role your own.§We have Friday drinks to get together with some of the wider teams you may not see during the week, yoga classes at a local studio in Parnell, onsite free bootcamp classes and discounted health insurance policies.§To apply, please send your updated cv with contact details through the link below. Our ideal candidate can start in a matter of weeks so only those already in New Zealand who hold the right to work (for 12 months) will be considered. No agencies please.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§What is your expected annual salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Supporter Care & Database Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697056.txt	§Supporter Care & Database Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supporter Care & Database Manager§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Direct Marketing & CRM§§§§§§Title: Supporter Care & Database Manager§Location: Wellington§Hours: Permanent full-time§As part of the largest humanitarian aid organisation in the world, New Zealand Red Cross plays a vital role in providing assistance to vulnerable people in New Zealand and overseas. New Zealand Red Cross is an organisation with 10,000 volunteers and 400 staff.§New Zealand Red Cross is looking to recruit an experienced Supporter Care & Database Manager who will be responsible of managing the integrity and effectiveness of the New Zealand Red Cross’ fundraising database to maximise the lifetime value of donors§We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce and adhere to best practice equal employment opportunity principles in all aspects of our recruitment and our ways of working.§In this role you will:§§Ensure that the investment made in the national fundraising database is maximised and that the system continues to develop as user requirements change.§ §In the event of a major emergency appeal, to be responsible for coordinating data selections, prompt gift processing and acknowledgement at very short notice, working in collaboration with the National Accounts, Communications and Programmes Teams. Emergency appeals may require working unsociable hours. § §Contribute to the development of annual operational plans and budgets which contribute to the achievement of the longer-term fundraising strategy.§ §Maintain accurate and up-to-date donor records, using the national fundraising database, electronic and paper records, and in accordance with the Privacy Act.§We encourage you to apply for this role if you have past experience in:§§Data analysis and database management § §Working in a customer / supporter service environment§ §Working within a fundraising context  § §Using a fundraising database § §Previous experience of The Raiser’s Edge and fundational training courses completed§ §Community engagement and fundraising §If you wish to discuss this opportunity or for further information, please contact Angela Calkin Goeres at Angela.CalkinGoeres@redcross.org.nz.§To download the job description and to apply for this position please click the 'Apply Now' button to be taken to the New Zealand Red Cross Careers page. If you are already viewing this via the New Zealand Red Cross Careers page, please click the active job description link below.§All applications MUST be submitted online. Applications close Wednesday,7th October 2020 at 5pm§New Zealand citizen or resident are considered for this job.§ §Supporter Care & Database Manager_JD [link removed]§§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697373.txt	§Digital Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Map Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§·       §An opportunity to lead and really grow your career§ §·       §A great mix of digital and traditional marketing§ §·       §30-34 hours per week§ § § §There are changes happening in our business with Just Water and Hometech coming together under Just Life Group. Just Water is the leading player in the supply of filtered, chilled water to New Zealand business and homes since 1989 and Hometech has been providing and installing home improvement products to New Zealanders since 1992 and has more than 70,000 customers across the country. § §We are a values-based organisation: Fun, Integrity, Respect, Service and Trust. Our values shape and drive our culture. We strive to bring them to life in our business and recognise and celebrate when we do just that§ §Now we need all your talents to join us and assist in the delivery of our brand plan and marketing strategy that will unlock the next stage of growth.§ §Your experience in both traditional and digital marketing in a fast moving industry means you know exactly what to expect. You love the speed, but also understand exactly what brands need to shine in a sometimes crowded market.  Having worked in, or at least with, a sales team before, you are strongly results focused.  You are a brilliant multi tasker, with a good understanding of systems and attention to detail.  You love challenges of digital and traditional – and appreciate a part time role that gives you flexibility and that work/life balance that you have been looking for § §Upbeat and tenacious you have the interpersonal skills to get on and get things done.  You just get on with the job.  You deliver what you say you will and you love supporting and leading others.  You’re easy to get along with and your easy manner belies your determination and strength.  You own your role and your project management skills mean you don’t miss a beat.§ §With your innovative approach you can “make magic without much” and your commercial savvy means you understand that generating sales opportunities is key.§ §You will have to hit the ground running, but there is lots of opportunity to add value and your passion and optimism means you will see the potential and eliminate the roadblocks.  While we need you for your experience, reporting to our General Manager there is lots to learn and with one direct report, you’ll get to coach and lead while growing your own skill base.§ §Ideally you tick the obvious boxes – a relevant marketing degree, solid experience in busy fast paced marketing and a real can do attitude but just ticking the boxes is not what we are about.  We are interested in you, all of you, your ability to connect with people, to understand brands and to try new things  You ooze credibility and you instil confidence and most importantly, you deliver results. § §We can provide challenges, responsibility, flexibility and great salary.  But we need your talents, leadership and enthusiasm to bring it all together.  § §Sound like you?  Then don’t hesitate contact our consultant Jo Malcolm on 021 685 631 during normal office hours, or apply via the Seek website.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50697924.txt	§Director – Marketing and Customer Experience§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Director – Marketing and Customer Experience§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Director – Marketing and Customer Experience §        §        §        §        §        §          §            §Stamp your mark on this new, senior leadership role.§            §Contribute to the success of a dynamic organisation.§            §Palmerston North based role.§          § §The organisation§ Enable New Zealand provides assistive technology, information and services to support disabled people to live everyday lives in their communities. It does this through its EASIE Living retail outlet and Demonstration Centre, and its Firstport website. It also provides services nationwide to the Ministry of Health, ACC and a number of DHBs. Based in Palmerston North, Enable New Zealand is an operating division of the MidCentral District Health Board.§ §The role§ As the Director – Marketing and Customer Experience, you will drive the brand strategy for Enable New Zealand. This strategy will position the organisation to meet the changing requirements of disabled people, who have more choices about how they manage their lives. In this dynamic environment you will identify opportunities for Enable New Zealand to further meet the needs of the people it supports and the organisations to which it contracts.§ You will lead your team of five to use a range of channels, including online and social media, to build awareness of, and increase engagement with, Enable New Zealand. This work will include refreshing Enable New Zealand’s brands, websites and collateral.§ As a member of the senior leadership team, you will contribute to the strategic management of the organisation.§ §Your skill set§ You will:§          §            §be an all-rounder with at least five years’ senior marketing communications experience,§            §have team leadership experience,§            §have a strong understanding of customers, how to reach them and enhance their experience,§            §be as at home developing strategies as you are helping deliver them,§            §relish combining your creativity with your commercial acumen.§          § §The benefits§ This varied role offers a chance to make your mark at a senior level on an organisation that is delivering important, life-changing services to thousands of New Zealanders.§ You will be able to work flexibly within an organisation that is big enough to provide invigorating professional challenges, while being small enough to offer a supportive environment.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Wednesday, 14 October 2020§ §APPLY AND VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7398§ §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ John King or Simon Boyes on §04 550 8000§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Stamp your mark on this new, senior leadership role.§Contribute to the success of a dynamic organisation.§Palmerston North based role.§ §The organisation§ Enable New Zealand provides assistive technology, information and services to support disabled people to live everyday lives in their communities. In this dynamic environment you will identify opportunities for Enable New Zealand to further meet the needs of the people it supports and the organisations to which it contracts.§ You will lead your team of five to use a range of channels, including online and social media, to build awareness of, and increase engagement with, Enable New Zealand. This work will include refreshing Enable New Zealand’s brands, websites and collateral.§ As a member of the senior leadership team, you will contribute to the strategic management of the organisation.§ §Your skill set§ You will:§be an all-rounder with at least five years’ senior marketing communications experience,§have team leadership experience,§have a strong understanding of customers, how to reach them and enhance their experience,§be as at home developing strategies as you are helping deliver them,§relish combining your creativity with your commercial acumen.§ §The benefits§ This varied role offers a chance to make your mark at a senior level on an organisation that is delivering important, life-changing services to thousands of New Zealanders.§ You will be able to work flexibly within an organisation that is big enough to provide invigorating professional challenges, while being small enough to offer a supportive environment.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Wednesday, 14 October 2020§ §APPLY AND VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7398§ §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ John King or Simon Boyes on §04 550 8000§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50699938.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Republic Home§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§About the business and the role§Republic Home is§ §a New Zealand market-leader of luxury furniture and homewares sourced world-wide. We are creating a new role in our business and are seeking an experienced Marketing Executive for both B2B and B2C markets.§We are looking for a person passionate about interiors that understands how to appropriately represent the Republic Home brand well, both in online and offline media, and will be a key player in growing the business.§POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:§Develop yearly / monthly marketing strategic plans through to tactical campaigns and liaise with Sales team to ensure plans successfully implemented.§Develop marketing strategies and create yearly/montly/weekly schedule to maximise brand visibility and company growth, identify business opportunities, analyse competitor activity, and report on market trends & customer needs.§Responsible for enhancing the brand and expanding the market, online and offline.§Create Loyalty programmes and associated promotions§Responsible for driving strategy, budget, execution and KPIs for all brand marketing initiatives to maximise ROI, and manage exhibitions, events and campaigns.§Lead and ensure all projects across the company align with strategic objectives and brand positioning.§Plan and manage ATL, BTL and TTL marketing tools, media channels, including content creation, design and copywriting.§Leverage customer insights, data and feedback, and survey customer satisfaction to further develop communications strategies.§Responsible for managing leads and enquiries from emailers, website and social media.§Develop marketing brand guidelines and collateral materials in collaboration with Online Store Manager/Graphic Designer, such as weekly emailers, company profile presentations, catalogues, brochures, flyers, web/digital assets, print advertising and communications.§Develop a network of trade customers, clients, professionals, interior designers, influencers and other related institutions.§Maintain existing and develop customer database.§Identify, analyse, negotiate, coordinate and monitor B2B projects with third parties, influencers, professionals, trade customers, etc. regarding marketing promotions.§Make sure strategic projects and policies are followed up and completed in a timely manner, ensuring high quality delivery.§QUALIFICATIONS:§Candidate must posess at least a Bachelor's, Masters or Post-graduate Degree in Marketing or equivalent§At least 5 years marketing work experience in the interiors industry or a related field§Preferably Manager/Assistant Manager specialised in Marketing/Business Development or equivalent§Experience of 2-3 years in B2B and digital marketing§Extensive network with marketing agencies, interior designers, influencers and related 3rd parties§SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:§Proven successful experience in a Marketing Executive role & in organising events§Ability to work independently and report remotely to Owners§Proven customer management and negotiation skills, & ability to build strong relationships with 3rd parties§Experience in customer loyalty programmes§Strong organisational skills§Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills§Ability to work under pressure and handle challenging situations§Driven, highly motivated and passionate about marketing and interiors§Strong IT skills§Top grooming and personal presentation§Required skill(s): Confidence, target oriented, strong attention to detail, good teamwork skills, great presenter and strong persuasion skills§Don't miss this amazing opportunity to be part of a unique brand in home fashion.§We look forward to hearing from you.§Please email your CV and cover letter to David & Ingrid at §david@republichome.com§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Associate Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700320.txt	§Marketing Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Associate§§Advertiser: §FlexiGroup§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.§ §This is the place where you’ll be hands on. Where new ideas are welcomed and expected.§ §At every level – and in every role – we’re doers and builders. Not Managers and minders.§ §flexigroup (ASX-FXL) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, everyday. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.§ §Whats so exciting about this role?§ §In this role you will help to deliver industry leading, best in class cross-channel acquisition and lifecycle initiatives to drive customer growth and market share for our commercial products that are in-line with business objectives. There arent just buzz words as our aim is to ultimately grow market share and retain existing customers and this role is purposed with driving acquisition and portfolio awareness across our Commercial network.§ §We are looking for a Marketing Manager - Commercial to lead marketing activity for the commercial side of the business which provides unique leasing solutions for businesses of all sizes across Enterprise, SME, Education and Retail.§ §What will you be responsible for?§ §This role is responsible for collaborating with key commercial partners to develop go-to-market initiatives and for designing and driving marketing initiatives that will encourage customers to lease with flexigroup as well as maintaining, creating and evolving marketing programmes.§ §The role requires creativity, as you will learn to build, refine and execute both business-to-business and business-to-customer campaigns and marketing initiatives. You will also help to design and implement B2B and B2C lifecycle programs to optimise customer on-boarding, engagement and ongoing communications. § §You’ll be someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves to simplify communication and messaging. You’ll work in conjunction with the General Manager of Marketing to ensure delivery of targets and business needs, and act as a custodian of brand presentation, product promotion and customer experience.§ § What are we looking for?§ §You’re organised and analytical, have a touch of creative, with an interest in optimising acquisition and retention and at the same time effectively managing budgets to ensure business targets are realised. You’ll also be interested in and able to decipher and understand data analytics and sharing the performance of your initiatives.§ §To be successful you’ll need to be a strong communicator and be able to develop collaborative working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.§ §Most importantly, we are a team of thinkers and do-ers. You will need to roll up your sleeves to help execute, deliver, and shift the dial.  § §What you will bring to the role:§ § §This role is responsible for collaborating with key commercial partners to develop go-to-market initiatives and for designing and driving marketing initiatives that will encourage customers to lease with flexigroup as well as maintaining, creating and evolving marketing programmes.§ §The role requires creativity, as you will learn to build, refine and execute both business-to-business and business-to-customer campaigns and marketing initiatives. You will also help to design and implement B2B and B2C lifecycle programs to optimise customer on-boarding, engagement and ongoing communications. § §You’ll be someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves to simplify communication and messaging. You’ll work in conjunction with the General Manager of Marketing to ensure delivery of targets and business needs, and act as a custodian of brand presentation, product promotion and customer experience.§ §You’re organised and analytical, have a touch of creative, with an interest in optimising acquisition and retention and at the same time effectively managing budgets to ensure business targets are realised. You’ll also be interested in and able to decipher and understand data analytics and sharing the performance of your initiatives.§ §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for - waste no time and apply today§ § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Global Product Manager  Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700924.txt	§Global Product Manager §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Global Product Manager §§Advertiser: §Fisher & Paykel Appliances§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Global Product Manager §      § §      §        §From the grandest of ideas to the smallest of details, every day we're turning our passion into performance and improving life through good design.§        §Here at Fisher & Paykel we're passionate about our customers and we care about the details. It's this passion that inspires us towards reaching our goal - to become the most human-centred appliance brand in the world.§        §Fisher & Paykel Appliances design, manufacture and market a full range of domestic appliances around the world. We are a global company built on a heritage of innovation and pioneering spirit that has seen us consistently deliver products tailored to our customer's needs since 1934.§        §The role?§        §Our Global Product Managers help drive the strategic direction and profitable growth of our various product portfolios. You will develop a deep understanding of the global competitive landscape for our Cooking category, and you'll have an innate ability to take hard and soft data from multiple sources and turn it into genuine insights. You'll also work closely with Chief Engineers, Marketing, our regional teams and General Manager of your Product Line to ensure the relevant product portfolio is consistent with the short and long term business strategy and goals for Fisher & Paykel Appliances.§        §This is a product focused role that can be based in Auckland or Dunedin, and needs someone who can establish and maintain strong links between the Product Development teams and our global sales and marketing teams. As part of the central Product Management team, you will liaise with our regional Product Management and Marketing teams to assist them with thorough understanding of products, as well as leading new product introductions to ensure we deliver a positive and timely impact in the market.§        §So that's the role? Who are you?§        §We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about products but has the ability to influence and lead across the business to ensure their commercial success. You'll also have had experience in dealing with multiple stakeholders to help compile business cases and briefs and to execute on agreed plans. You are also comfortable operating in situations where there is some level of ambiguity. You'll inherently know how to extract and analyze information, and concisely present this to all the relevant stakeholders. In time, you will be seen as a trusted category expert within our business.§        §You'll thrive in a hands-on environment and will be great at influencing stakeholders across the business and throughout the product life cycle with great work, sound reasoning, and your natural collaborative style.§        §On the technical side, you'll have a Bachelor's Degree in Business or Engineering. You might even be thinking about doing an MBA.§        §You are likely to have previous working experience in either product management, or even in a product development role, but don't let us pigeon-hole you. A key component of what you have to offer is that you've got a genuine interest in the business as well as the product side of the equation. Finally, while a certain level of aptitude is important to us, the right attitude is crucial.§        §What we offer§        §Team-based culture, great development opportunities, a challenging and supportive work environment, leading technology, great physical work environment, superannuation scheme, on-site subsidized café.§        §Fisher & Paykel is about collaboration, delivering what we promise, and aspiring to be the best. If you're ready to show us that you have got what it takes, then we want to hear from you, apply online now!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§From the grandest of ideas to the smallest of details, every day we're turning our passion into performance and improving life through good design.§Here at Fisher & Paykel we're passionate about our customers and we care about the details. It's this passion that inspires us towards reaching our goal - to become the most human-centred appliance brand in the world.§Fisher & Paykel Appliances design, manufacture and market a full range of domestic appliances around the world. We are a global company built on a heritage of innovation and pioneering spirit that has seen us consistently deliver products tailored to our customer's needs since 1934.§The role?§Our Global Product Managers help drive the strategic direction and profitable growth of our various product portfolios. You will develop a deep understanding of the global competitive landscape for our Cooking category, and you'll have an innate ability to take hard and soft data from multiple sources and turn it into genuine insights. You'll also work closely with Chief Engineers, Marketing, our regional teams and General Manager of your Product Line to ensure the relevant product portfolio is consistent with the short and long term business strategy and goals for Fisher & Paykel Appliances.§This is a product focused role that can be based in Auckland or Dunedin, and needs someone who can establish and maintain strong links between the Product Development teams and our global sales and marketing teams. As part of the central Product Management team, you will liaise with our regional Product Management and Marketing teams to assist them with thorough understanding of products, as well as leading new product introductions to ensure we deliver a positive and timely impact in the market.§So that's the role? Who are you?§We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about products but has the ability to influence and lead across the business to ensure their commercial success. You'll also have had experience in dealing with multiple stakeholders to help compile business cases and briefs and to execute on agreed plans. You are also comfortable operating in situations where there is some level of ambiguity. You'll inherently know how to extract and analyze information, and concisely present this to all the relevant stakeholders. In time, you will be seen as a trusted category expert within our business.§You'll thrive in a hands-on environment and will be great at influencing stakeholders across the business and throughout the product life cycle with great work, sound reasoning, and your natural collaborative style.§On the technical side, you'll have a Bachelor's Degree in Business or Engineering. You might even be thinking about doing an MBA.§You are likely to have previous working experience in either product management, or even in a product development role, but don't let us pigeon-hole you. A key component of what you have to offer is that you've got a genuine interest in the business as well as the product side of the equation. Finally, while a certain level of aptitude is important to us, the right attitude is crucial.§What we offer§Team-based culture, great development opportunities, a challenging and supportive work environment, leading technology, great physical work environment, superannuation scheme, on-site subsidized café.§Fisher & Paykel is about collaboration, delivering what we promise, and aspiring to be the best. If you're ready to show us that you have got what it takes, then we want to hear from you, apply online now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

In time, you will be seen as a trusted category expert within our business.§You'll thrive in a hands-on environment and will be great at influencing stakeholders across the business and throughout the product life cycle with great work, sound reasoning, and your natural collaborative style.§On the technical side, you'll have a Bachelor's Degree in Business or Engineering. You might even be thinking about doing an MBA.§You are likely to have previous working experience in either product management, or even in a product development role, but don't let us pigeon-hole you. A key component of what you have to offer is that you've got a genuine interest in the business as well as the product side of the equation. Finally, while a certain level of aptitude is important to us, the right attitude is crucial.§What we offer§Team-based culture, great development opportunities, a challenging and supportive work environment, leading technology, great physical work environment, on-site subsidized café.§Fisher & Paykel is about collaboration, delivering what we promise, and aspiring to be the best. If you're ready to show us that you have got what it takes, then we want to hear from you, apply online now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We utilise focused digital influencer campaigns to promote and support our brand and our products using customer feedback and testimonials to enhance our branding.§In this challenging role, you will work closely with our marketing & sales teams yet also have a good degree of autonomy to design and deliver programs and campaigns to support our revenue and business goals. §With a proven background and at least 3 years in digital marketing and track record in the use of social media and influencer programs working in or into the North American markets you will have expertise in the use of influencer management technology to develop, deliver and manage multiple influencer campaigns and assess their effectiveness and ROI. §Your excellent analysis skills enable you to turn data into meaningful management information and you’ll be able to design and operate “dashboard” reporting so that the management team can monitor campaign effectiveness at a glance.§You will be a proactive self-starter with a strong results and delivery focus and with a collegial approach you’ll operate well within a busy, deadline driven environment and have a “can do” attitude. §A relevant tertiary qualification, preferably in marketing is advantageous, as is a background in consumer products, FMCG and DTC.§If you have what it takes to help us grow our business and have the energy and enthusiasm to take on this role, please apply below.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing specialist?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§
